samuel-sachs.bio: American Jewish financier (1851-1935), son-in-law of Marcus Goldman, who joined the firm in 1882 to form Goldman, Sachs & Co. Expanded the business into investment banking and underwriting, establishing the firm's role in public offerings.

stephen-schwarzman.name: Stephen Schwarzman
stephen-schwarzman.bio: American billionaire financier. Born 1947 in Philadelphia to a Jewish family. Co-founded Blackstone Group in 1985, which became the world's largest alternative investment firm managing over $1 trillion. Chairman of Trump's Strategic and Policy Forum.

jonathan-gray.name: Jonathan Gray
jonathan-gray.bio: American billionaire businessman. Born 1969 to a Jewish family. President and COO of Blackstone Group, the world's largest alternative asset manager with over $1 trillion in assets under management. Previously global head of Blackstone's real estate business.

herb-abramson.name: Herb Abramson
herb-abramson.bio: American record executive (1916-1999). Born to a Jewish family in Brooklyn, New York. Co-founded Atlantic Records with Ahmet Ertegun in 1947. Atlantic became one of the most important labels in music history, launching artists across jazz, R&B, rock, and soul.

john-janick.name: John Janick
john-janick.bio: American Jewish music executive and CEO of Interscope Geffen A&M Records since 2014. Founded Fueled by Ramen at age 16, which discovered Paramore, Panic! at the Disco, and Twenty One Pilots. One of the most successful A&R executives in modern music.

jac-holzman.name: Jac Holzman
jac-holzman.bio: American record executive. Born 1931 in New York City to a Jewish family. Founder of Elektra Records in 1950, signing acts like The Doors, Love, and Judy Collins. Pioneer of the folk and rock music scenes. Also founded Nonesuch Records. Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductee.

herb-alpert.name: Herb Alpert
herb-alpert.bio: American Jewish musician, trumpeter, and co-founder of A&M Records alongside Jerry Moss. Sold over 72 million records as leader of Herb Alpert & the Tijuana Brass. Sold A&M to PolyGram for $500 million. The Herb Alpert Foundation supports arts education.

lucian-grainge.name: Lucian Grainge
lucian-grainge.bio: British Jewish music executive and chairman and CEO of Universal Music Group, the world's largest music company. Knighted in 2016 for services to music. Under his leadership, UMG went public in 2021 at a $42 billion valuation.

clive-davis.name: Clive Davis
clive-davis.bio: Jewish music executive who discovered Whitney Houston, Alicia Keys, and many others.

richard-simon.name: Richard Simon
richard-simon.bio: American publisher (1899-1960). Born to a Jewish family in New York. Co-founded Simon & Schuster publishing house with Max Schuster in 1924. Their first publication was a crossword puzzle book. Grew S&S into one of the "Big Five" publishing houses.

max-schuster.name: Max Schuster
max-schuster.bio: American publisher (1897-1970). Born to a Jewish family of Austrian immigrants in Kalusz, Austria-Hungary. Co-founded Simon & Schuster with Richard Simon in 1924. Known for innovative marketing and building S&S into a major force in American publishing.

bennett-cerf.name: Bennett Cerf
bennett-cerf.bio: American Jewish publisher and co-founder of Random House in 1927. Pioneered the modern publishing industry and fought censorship in the landmark case that legalized James Joyce's Ulysses in America. Also known as a panelist on TV's What's My Line?

alfred-a-knopf.name: Alfred A. Knopf
alfred-a-knopf.bio: American Jewish publisher (1892-1984) who founded Alfred A. Knopf Inc. in 1915. Published Nobel laureates and literary giants including Thomas Mann, Albert Camus, and Toni Morrison. Known for exquisite book design and the distinctive Borzoi colophon.

richard-robinson.name: Richard Robinson
richard-robinson.bio: American Jewish publisher and former CEO and president of Scholastic Corporation, the world's largest publisher of children's books. Under his leadership, Scholastic published the Harry Potter series in America, transforming the company.

warren-eisenberg.name: Warren Eisenberg
warren-eisenberg.bio: American businessman. Born 1929 to a Jewish family. Co-founded Bed Bath & Beyond with Leonard Feinstein in 1971. Grew it to over 1,000 stores. The company filed for bankruptcy in 2023 after decades as a dominant home goods retailer.

leonard-feinstein.name: Leonard Feinstein
leonard-feinstein.bio: American businessman. Born 1937 to a Jewish family. Co-founded Bed Bath & Beyond with Warren Eisenberg in 1971 in Springfield, New Jersey. Built the chain into the largest home furnishing specialty retailer in North America. Retired in 2014.

thomas-stemberg.name: Thomas Stemberg
thomas-stemberg.bio: American businessman (1949-2015). Born to a Jewish family in Newark, New Jersey. Founded Staples Inc. in 1986 with Leo Kahn, creating the office supply superstore category. Staples grew to over 2,000 stores. Close associate of Mitt Romney and Bain Capital.

charles-lazarus.name: Charles Lazarus
charles-lazarus.bio: American businessman (1923-2018). Born in Washington, D.C. to a Jewish family. Founded Toys "R" Us in 1948, growing it from a single baby furniture store into the world's largest toy retailer with over 1,500 stores globally before its bankruptcy in 2017.

isidor-straus.name: Isidor Straus
isidor-straus.bio: German-born American Jewish businessman (1845-1912) and co-owner of Macy's department store. Died alongside his wife Ida on the Titanic after refusing to board a lifeboat before women and children. Their story became one of the most famous from the disaster.

nathan-straus.name: Nathan Straus
nathan-straus.bio: German-born American Jewish businessman and philanthropist (1848-1931), co-owner of Macy's and Abraham & Straus. Pioneered the pasteurization of milk in America, saving thousands of children's lives. A major Zionist who supported the settlement of Palestine.

herbert-marcus.name: Herbert Marcus
herbert-marcus.bio: American businessman (1878-1950). Jewish co-founder of Neiman Marcus in 1907 in Dallas, Texas, with his sister Carrie Marcus Neiman and her husband A.L. Neiman. Built Neiman Marcus into one of America's most prestigious luxury department stores.

stanley-marcus.name: Stanley Marcus
stanley-marcus.bio: American Jewish retail executive (1905-2002) who transformed Neiman Marcus from a regional Dallas store into a global luxury brand. Pioneered the Neiman Marcus Christmas Book and customer service as a luxury philosophy. Created the "Fortnight" cultural events.

joseph-bloomingdale.name: Joseph Bloomingdale
joseph-bloomingdale.bio: American retailer (1842-1904). Born to a Jewish family in New York. Co-founded Bloomingdale's department store with his brother Lyman in 1861 on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. Bloomingdale's grew into one of America's premier upscale department stores.

julius-rosenwald.name: Julius Rosenwald
julius-rosenwald.bio: Jewish businessman who built Sears into a retail giant. Major philanthropist who funded schools for African Americans.

stan-lee.name: Stan Lee
stan-lee.bio: Born Stanley Lieber. Jewish comic book writer who co-created Spider-Man, X-Men, and many others.

jack-kirby.name: Jack Kirby
jack-kirby.bio: Born Jacob Kurtzberg. Jewish comic book artist who co-created Captain America, Hulk, Fantastic Four.

jerry-siegel.name: Jerry Siegel
jerry-siegel.bio: American comic book writer (1914-1996). Born in Cleveland, Ohio, to Jewish Lithuanian immigrant parents. Co-created Superman with Joe Shuster in 1933, published 1938. Superman became the archetypal superhero and one of the most recognizable fictional characters worldwide.

joe-shuster.name: Joe Shuster
joe-shuster.bio: Canadian-American comic book artist (1914-1992). Born in Toronto to Jewish Dutch immigrant parents. Co-created Superman with Jerry Siegel. Drew the original Superman comics. Moved to Cleveland where he met Siegel. Struggled financially despite Superman's massive success.

bob-kane.name: Bob Kane
bob-kane.bio: American Jewish comic book artist and writer (1915-1998), born Robert Kahn, who co-created Batman and his related characters for DC Comics in 1939. Created one of the most iconic fictional characters in history, though credit was shared with uncredited co-creator Bill Finger.

louis-b-mayer.name: Louis B. Mayer
louis-b-mayer.bio: Russian-born American Jewish film executive (1884-1957) who co-founded Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) and made it Hollywood's most prestigious studio. Known as the most powerful person in Hollywood for decades. Created the studio system that defined Golden Age cinema.

samuel-goldwyn.name: Samuel Goldwyn
samuel-goldwyn.bio: Polish-born American Jewish film producer (1879-1974), born Szmuel Gelbfisz, who co-founded Goldwyn Pictures (later MGM) and Samuel Goldwyn Productions. Won multiple Academy Awards and was known for "Goldwynisms" - his humorous malapropisms.

jack-warner.name: Jack Warner
jack-warner.bio: Canadian-American film executive (1892-1978). Born Jack Leonard Warner in London, Ontario, to Jewish parents from Krasnosielc, Poland. Co-founded Warner Bros. Pictures with his brothers. Led the studio for four decades. Pioneer of "talkies" (The Jazz Singer, 1927).

harry-warner.name: Harry Warner
harry-warner.bio: Polish-American film executive (1881-1958). Born Hirsz Wonsal in Krasnosielc, Poland, to a Jewish family. Eldest of the Warner brothers. Co-founded Warner Bros. Business-minded brother who managed the studio's finances while Jack ran production.

adolph-zukor.name: Adolph Zukor
adolph-zukor.bio: Hungarian-Jewish immigrant (1873-1976). Founded Paramount Pictures. Lived to 103.

harry-cohn.name: Harry Cohn
harry-cohn.bio: American Jewish film executive (1891-1958) who co-founded and ran Columbia Pictures for over 30 years. Known for his autocratic management, he built Columbia from poverty row to a major studio. Frank Capra's It Happened One Night won Columbia's first Best Picture Oscar.

carl-laemmle.name: Carl Laemmle
carl-laemmle.bio: German-born American Jewish film pioneer (1867-1939) who founded Universal Pictures in 1912. One of the original Hollywood moguls who built the studio system. Created Universal City, the world's first purpose-built movie studio and theme park.

william-fox.name: William Fox
william-fox.bio: Hungarian-born American Jewish film executive (1879-1952) who founded the Fox Film Corporation in 1915, later merged into 20th Century Fox. Pioneered sound-on-film technology (Movietone) and built a massive theater chain before losing his empire in the Great Depression.

marc-randolph.name: Marc Randolph
marc-randolph.bio: American Jewish entrepreneur and co-founder of Netflix. Served as Netflix's founding CEO before handing the role to Reed Hastings. Previously worked at Borland International and co-founded several other companies. Helped conceive the original DVD-by-mail model.

jon-feltheimer.name: Jon Feltheimer
jon-feltheimer.bio: American media executive. Born to a Jewish family. CEO of Lionsgate Entertainment since 2000. Oversaw Lionsgate's growth from a small company to a major entertainment studio producing The Hunger Games, John Wick, and hundreds of films and TV shows.

johny-srouji.name: Johny Srouji
johny-srouji.bio: Israeli executive and Apple's Senior Vice President of Hardware Technologies since 2015. Born to an Arab Christian family in Haifa. Leads the team that designs Apple Silicon chips (M1/M2/M3 series), which have transformed Mac and iPad performance.

navot-volk.name: Navot Volk
navot-volk.bio: Israeli technology executive who has held leadership roles at major tech companies. Known for his expertise in enterprise technology and cloud computing. Part of Israel's influential tech leadership community in the global technology sector.

nir-zuk.name: Nir Zuk
nir-zuk.bio: Israeli co-founder of Palo Alto Networks, previously co-developed the first stateful inspection firewall at Check Point.

dmitri-alperovitch.name: Dmitri Alperovitch
dmitri-alperovitch.bio: Russian-born American cybersecurity expert and co-founder of CrowdStrike, one of the world's leading cybersecurity companies. Born to a Jewish family in Moscow. First to publicly attribute the 2016 DNC hack to Russian intelligence. Executive chairman of Silverado Policy Accelerator.

danny-lewin.name: Danny Lewin
danny-lewin.bio: Israeli-American mathematician and co-founder of Akamai. First victim of the 9/11 attacks.

eli-hurvitz.name: Eli Hurvitz
eli-hurvitz.bio: Israeli businessman (1932-2011) who served as president and CEO of Teva Pharmaceutical Industries, transforming it from a small Israeli company into the world's largest generic drug manufacturer. Awarded the Israel Prize for his contributions to industry.

tal-zaks.name: Tal Zaks
tal-zaks.bio: Israeli physician-scientist who served as Moderna's Chief Medical Officer during COVID-19 vaccine development.

michael-dowling.name: Michael Dowling
michael-dowling.bio: American healthcare executive and president and CEO of Northwell Health, the largest healthcare provider in New York State. Born in Ireland, he has built Northwell into a major health system and been a leading voice during healthcare crises.

michael-milken.name: Michael Milken
michael-milken.bio: American financier and philanthropist. Born 1946 in Encino, California, to a Jewish family. Known as the "Junk Bond King" - pioneer of high-yield bond financing at Drexel Burnham Lambert. Convicted of securities fraud in 1990. Pardoned by Trump in 2020. Major medical research philanthropist.

mark-davis.name: Mark Davis
mark-davis.bio: American businessman and principal owner of the Las Vegas Raiders (formerly Oakland Raiders) NFL team. Son of legendary owner Al Davis. Oversaw the team's relocation from Oakland to the $1.9 billion Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas.

marc-lore.name: Marc Lore
marc-lore.bio: American Jewish entrepreneur and businessman who co-founded Jet.com, sold it to Walmart for $3.3 billion, and became CEO of Walmart's US e-commerce operations. Co-founder of Diapers.com (sold to Amazon). Now building a utopian city called Telosa.

marc-lasry.name: Marc Lasry
marc-lasry.bio: Moroccan-born American Jewish billionaire hedge fund manager and co-founder of Avenue Capital Group. Former co-owner of the Milwaukee Bucks NBA team. Known for distressed debt investing and Democratic party fundraising.

tony-ressler.name: Tony Ressler
tony-ressler.bio: American Jewish billionaire businessman, co-founder of Ares Management and Apollo Global Management, and principal owner of the Atlanta Hawks NBA team. Previously co-founded Apollo with Leon Black and Josh Harris. One of the most successful private equity investors.

mat-ishbia.name: Mat Ishbia
mat-ishbia.bio: Jewish billionaire, CEO of United Wholesale Mortgage, owner of the Phoenix Suns.

dan-gilbert.name: Dan Gilbert
dan-gilbert.bio: Jewish billionaire, founder of Quicken Loans and owner of the Cleveland Cavaliers.

wyc-grousbeck.name: Wyc Grousbeck
wyc-grousbeck.bio: American Jewish businessman and lead owner and governor of the Boston Celtics NBA team since 2002. Under his ownership, the Celtics won the 2008 NBA Championship. Also co-founded Causeway Media Partners venture capital firm.

tom-dundon.name: Tom Dundon
tom-dundon.bio: American Jewish businessman, founder of Dundon Capital Partners, and owner of the Carolina Hurricanes NHL team since 2018. Made his fortune founding Santander Consumer USA (previously Drive Financial Services). Revitalized the Hurricanes franchise.

jeff-vinik.name: Jeff Vinik
jeff-vinik.bio: American Jewish billionaire investor and former manager of the Fidelity Magellan Fund. Owner of the Tampa Bay Lightning NHL team, leading the team to back-to-back Stanley Cup championships in 2020 and 2021. Major developer of the Water Street Tampa project.

david-simon.name: David Simon
david-simon.bio: Chairman, CEO, and President of Simon Property Group. Son of co-founder Melvin Simon.

ric-clark.name: Ric Clark
ric-clark.bio: American real estate executive and former CEO of Brookfield Property Partners, managing one of the world's largest commercial real estate portfolios. Has played a significant role in major urban development projects across North America.

william-mack.name: William Mack
william-mack.bio: American real estate investor, co-founder of AREA Property Partners, and former chairman of the Mack-Cali Realty Corporation. One of the most prominent figures in the New York and New Jersey commercial real estate markets.

albert-ratner.name: Albert Ratner
albert-ratner.bio: American real estate executive and philanthropist. Born 1927 to a Jewish family in Cleveland, Ohio. Former co-chairman of Forest City Realty Trust. Major Jewish communal leader and supporter of Cleveland cultural institutions and the Ratner School.

william-rudin.name: William Rudin
william-rudin.bio: American real estate executive. CEO of Rudin Management Company, one of New York City's oldest and largest privately held real estate families. Jewish. The Rudin family has been developing and managing New York buildings since 1925.

eric-rudin.name: Eric Rudin
eric-rudin.bio: American real estate executive. Co-chairman of Rudin Management Company alongside his cousin William. Jewish. The Rudin family owns and manages over 30 properties in New York City comprising over 10 million square feet of office and residential space.

douglas-durst.name: Douglas Durst
douglas-durst.bio: American Jewish real estate developer and chairman of The Durst Organization. Led the development of One World Trade Center (Freedom Tower) and Bank of America Tower, two of New York's most significant skyscrapers. Pioneer of green building practices.

william-zeckendorf-jr.name: William Zeckendorf Jr.
william-zeckendorf-jr.bio: American real estate developer. Born 1929, Jewish family. Son of legendary developer William Zeckendorf Sr. Co-founded Zeckendorf Realty with his brother. Developed notable Manhattan residential projects including 515 Park Avenue and 15 Central Park West.

arthur-zeckendorf.name: Arthur Zeckendorf
arthur-zeckendorf.bio: American real estate developer. Born 1962, Jewish family. Co-founder of Zeckendorf Realty. Developed luxury Manhattan condominiums including 520 Park Avenue and 50 United Nations Plaza. Son of William Zeckendorf Jr., grandson of William Zeckendorf Sr.

nathan-handwerker.name: Nathan Handwerker
nathan-handwerker.bio: Polish-Jewish immigrant (1891-1974) who founded Nathan's Famous hot dog stand on Coney Island in 1916. Started with a $300 loan and a nickel hot dog, building an American food icon. Nathan's Famous Fourth of July Hot Dog Eating Contest is a national tradition.

reuben-mattus.name: Reuben Mattus
reuben-mattus.bio: Polish-American businessman (1912-1994). Born Reuben Mattus in Poland to a Jewish family. Founded Haagen-Dazs ice cream in the Bronx in 1960 with his wife Rose. Created the made-up Scandinavian-sounding name to evoke artisanal quality. Sold to Pillsbury in 1983.

leonard-marsh.name: Leonard Marsh
leonard-marsh.bio: American businessman. Co-founded Snapple beverages in 1972 in Brooklyn, New York, with Hyman Golden and Arnold Greenberg. All three co-founders were from Jewish families. Sold Snapple to Quaker Oats for $1.7 billion in 1994.

hyman-golden.name: Hyman Golden
hyman-golden.bio: American businessman (1930s-2008). Co-founded Snapple beverages with Leonard Marsh and Arnold Greenberg in Brooklyn. From a Jewish family. Helped build Snapple from a small natural juice company into a national brand before selling for $1.7 billion.

arnold-greenberg.name: Arnold Greenberg
arnold-greenberg.bio: American businessman. Co-founded Snapple beverages with Leonard Marsh and Hyman Golden in Brooklyn. From a Jewish family. The three friends grew Snapple from a small operation into one of America's best-known beverage brands.

daniel-lubetzky.name: Daniel Lubetzky
daniel-lubetzky.bio: Mexican-American Jewish entrepreneur, founder of KIND Snacks, which he sold at a valuation of over $5 billion. Born in Mexico City to a Holocaust survivor father. Founder of the OneVoice Movement promoting Israeli-Palestinian peace.

shaul-elovitch.name: Shaul Elovitch
shaul-elovitch.bio: Israeli businessman and former controlling shareholder of Bezeq, Israel's largest telecommunications company. Central figure in Israel's "Case 4000" corruption trial involving former PM Benjamin Netanyahu. Convicted of bribery in 2025.

nochi-dankner.name: Nochi Dankner
nochi-dankner.bio: Israeli businessman and former controlling shareholder of IDB Holding Corporation, once Israel's largest conglomerate. His empire collapsed in 2012 amid a debt crisis, and he was convicted of market manipulation. A cautionary tale of Israeli tycoon excess.

pinhas-rutenberg.name: Pinhas Rutenberg
pinhas-rutenberg.bio: Russian-born Jewish engineer and Zionist leader (1879-1942) who founded the Palestine Electric Corporation (later Israel Electric Corporation). A former Russian revolutionary who became one of the most important builders of pre-state Israel's infrastructure.

yitzhak-tshuva.name: Yitzhak Tshuva
yitzhak-tshuva.bio: Israeli billionaire businessman and chairman of the Delek Group, a major energy and infrastructure conglomerate. His discovery of the Tamar and Leviathan natural gas fields transformed Israel into an energy exporter. Also owns the David Intercontinental hotel chain.

chaim-katzman.name: Chaim Katzman
chaim-katzman.bio: Israeli billionaire real estate mogul. Born 1950. Founder and chairman of Gazit-Globe, one of Israel's largest real estate companies with global operations. Pioneered Israeli investment in international commercial real estate markets across Europe, Brazil, and North America.

david-azrieli.name: David Azrieli
david-azrieli.bio: Israeli-Canadian Jewish businessman and architect (1922-2014), founder of the Azrieli Group. Holocaust survivor from Poland who became one of Israel's wealthiest people. Built the iconic Azrieli Center towers in Tel Aviv and was a major philanthropist.

lev-leviev.name: Lev Leviev
lev-leviev.bio: Uzbek-born Israeli Jewish billionaire businessman known as the "King of Diamonds." Founded Africa-Israel Investments and the Leviev Group. Built a global diamond empire challenging De Beers' monopoly. Also a major benefactor of Chabad institutions worldwide.

leon-recanati.name: Leon Recanati
leon-recanati.bio: Israeli Jewish businessman and investor from the prominent Recanati banking family. Co-founded Discount Investment Corporation and GlenRock Israel. His family established the Israel Discount Bank, one of the country's largest financial institutions.

guy-sella.name: Guy Sella
guy-sella.bio: Israeli electrical engineer and co-founder of SolarEdge Technologies, a global leader in smart energy solutions. SolarEdge's DC optimized inverters revolutionized the solar power industry. The company is traded on NASDAQ with billions in market cap.

shlomo-barak.name: Shlomo Barak
shlomo-barak.bio: Israeli technology entrepreneur and co-founder of AudioCodes, a leading provider of voice networking and media processing solutions. Part of Israel's pioneering generation of telecom technology entrepreneurs that helped build the "Startup Nation."

eyal-waldman.name: Eyal Waldman
eyal-waldman.bio: Israeli entrepreneur and co-founder of Mellanox Technologies, a semiconductor company specializing in high-performance networking. Sold Mellanox to NVIDIA for $6.9 billion in 2020, one of the largest Israeli tech acquisitions. Lost his daughter in a 2014 terror attack.

david-dahan.name: David Dahan
david-dahan.bio: Israeli AI chip engineer. Co-founded Habana Labs, an Israeli AI processor company acquired by Intel for $2 billion in 2019. Developed the Gaudi AI training processor and Goya AI inference processor. Major figure in Israel's deep tech semiconductor industry.

doron-myersdorf.name: Doron Myersdorf
doron-myersdorf.bio: Israeli tech entrepreneur. Founder and CEO of StoreDot, an Israeli company developing extreme fast-charging (XFC) battery technology for electric vehicles. StoreDot's technology aims to fully charge EV batteries in under 10 minutes.

omer-keilaf.name: Omer Keilaf
omer-keilaf.bio: Israeli entrepreneur and co-founder of Innoviz Technologies, a leading developer of LiDAR sensors for autonomous vehicles. The company went public via SPAC in 2021. Part of Israel's growing autonomous driving technology ecosystem.

daniel-barel.name: Daniel Barel
daniel-barel.bio: Israeli entrepreneur and co-founder of REE Automotive, which is developing a revolutionary electric vehicle platform. The modular skateboard chassis design aims to transform how electric vehicles are built. A graduate of the Technion.

maxim-pasik.name: Maxim Pasik
maxim-pasik.bio: Israeli-Russian businessman. President and chairman of Watergen, an Israeli company that developed atmospheric water generation technology - extracting drinking water from air. The technology has humanitarian applications in water-scarce regions worldwide.

gavriel-iddan.name: Gavriel Iddan
gavriel-iddan.bio: Israeli inventor and engineer who developed the PillCam, the pioneering capsule endoscopy technology at Given Imaging. The PillCam revolutionized gastrointestinal diagnostics by allowing doctors to see inside the digestive tract without invasive procedures.

idan-ofer.name: Idan Ofer
idan-ofer.bio: Israeli-born billionaire businessman and owner of Quantum Pacific Group, one of the world's largest private shipping companies. Son of Sammy Ofer. Holds major stakes in Kenon Holdings and Tower Semiconductor. Based in London, one of Israel's wealthiest expatriates.

barrie-levitt.name: Barrie Levitt
barrie-levitt.bio: South African-born Israeli pharmaceutical executive and co-founder of Taro Pharmaceutical Industries. Built Taro into a major generic drug manufacturer before it was acquired by Sun Pharmaceutical. Contributed to Israel's pharmaceutical industry growth.

edmond-de-rothschild.name: Edmond de Rothschild
edmond-de-rothschild.bio: Jewish French banker who funded early Jewish settlements and wineries in Palestine.

eliezer-manor.name: Eliezer Manor
eliezer-manor.bio: Israeli technology entrepreneur and co-founder of AudioCodes alongside Shlomo Barak. Helped develop Israel's voice-over-IP technology sector. Part of the generation of Israeli tech pioneers who built the country's reputation as a technology innovation hub.

avi-nir.name: Avi Nir
avi-nir.bio: Israeli media executive. CEO of Keshet Media Group, the parent company of Keshet Broadcasting (Channel 12), Israel's most-watched commercial TV network. Keshet International exports Israeli TV formats globally, including the hit show "Rising Star."

amos-regev.name: Amos Regev
amos-regev.bio: Israeli journalist and media executive who served as editor-in-chief and CEO of Channel 13 News. One of Israel's most prominent news editors, he has shaped Israeli media discourse through his leadership of major news organizations.

matthew-freud.name: Matthew Freud
matthew-freud.bio: British Jewish public relations executive and founder of Freuds, one of the UK's largest PR firms. Great-grandson of Sigmund Freud and former son-in-law of Rupert Murdoch. Known for his high-profile client roster and influential connections.

charles-saatchi.name: Charles Saatchi
charles-saatchi.bio: Iraqi-born British Jewish advertising mogul who co-founded Saatchi & Saatchi, once the world's largest advertising agency. Also a renowned contemporary art collector who founded the Saatchi Gallery and helped launch the careers of the Young British Artists.

maurice-saatchi.name: Maurice Saatchi
maurice-saatchi.bio: Iraqi-born British Jewish advertising executive, co-founder of Saatchi & Saatchi and later M&C Saatchi. Created Baron Saatchi of Staplefield in 1996. Served as co-chairman of the Conservative Party. Pioneered political advertising campaigns for Margaret Thatcher.

martin-sorrell.name: Martin Sorrell
martin-sorrell.bio: Jewish British businessman who founded and built WPP into the world's largest ad company.

israel-sieff.name: Israel Sieff
israel-sieff.bio: British Jewish businessman (1889-1972) and chairman of Marks & Spencer. A leading Zionist who was close friends with Chaim Weizmann and instrumental in the Balfour Declaration. His family intermarried with the Marks family and shaped M&S into a British institution.

philip-green.name: Philip Green
philip-green.bio: British billionaire businessman. Born 1952 in Croydon to a Jewish family. Chairman of Arcadia Group (Topshop, Dorothy Perkins, Miss Selfridge). Controversial figure - criticized for BHS pension scandal and #MeToo allegations. Lost billionaire status after Arcadia collapse.

shay-segev.name: Shay Segev
shay-segev.bio: Israeli-born business executive. Former CEO of DAZN Group, the global sports streaming platform. Previously served as CEO of Entain (formerly GVC Holdings), one of the world's largest sports betting and gaming companies.

aharon-shaked.name: Aharon Shaked
aharon-shaked.bio: Israeli entrepreneur. Co-founder of 888 Holdings, one of the world's leading online gambling companies headquartered in Gibraltar. 888 operates casino, poker, sport betting, and bingo platforms serving millions of customers worldwide.

alon-gonen.name: Alon Gonen
alon-gonen.bio: Israeli tech entrepreneur. Co-founded CyberArk Software, a cybersecurity company specializing in privileged access management. CyberArk is publicly traded on NASDAQ with a market cap exceeding $10 billion.

marcel-bleustein-blanchet.name: Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet
marcel-bleustein-blanchet.bio: French advertising pioneer (1906-1996). Born into a Jewish family in Paris. Founded Publicis Groupe in 1926, which grew into the world's third-largest communications group. Fought in the French Resistance during WWII under the name Pierre Blanchet.

maurice-l-vy.name: Maurice Lévy
maurice-l-vy.bio: French Jewish advertising executive who led Publicis Groupe as chairman and CEO from 1987 to 2017, transforming it into the world's third-largest communications group. Under his leadership, Publicis acquired Saatchi & Saatchi and merged operations with Omnicom.

marcel-dassault.name: Marcel Dassault
marcel-dassault.bio: French Jewish industrialist and politician (1892-1986), born Marcel Bloch, who founded Dassault Aviation. Holocaust survivor from Buchenwald who converted to Catholicism. Built France's premier aerospace company producing the Mirage and Rafale fighter jets.

serge-dassault.name: Serge Dassault
serge-dassault.bio: French billionaire industrialist and politician (1925-2018). Born Serge Bloch to a Jewish family (father Marcel changed name to Dassault, meaning "on the attack"). Ran the Dassault Group (Rafale fighter jets, Falcon business jets, Le Figaro). Served as a French senator.

hubert-sagni-res.name: Hubert Sagnières
hubert-sagni-res.bio: French Jewish businessman and CEO of Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield, the world's largest listed commercial real estate company. Oversaw the acquisition of Frank Lowy's Westfield Corporation. Known for transforming retail real estate with experiential shopping concepts.

david-schneider.name: David Schneider
david-schneider.bio: German-Israeli entrepreneur. Co-founder of Zalando, Europe's largest online fashion platform with over 50 million active customers. Born in Israel, moved to Germany. Built Zalando into a $10+ billion company.

gunter-demnig.name: Gunter Demnig
gunter-demnig.bio: German artist (born 1947) who created the Stolpersteine (stumbling stones) project, the world's largest decentralized memorial to Holocaust victims. Has installed over 100,000 brass cobblestones across Europe, each commemorating an individual victim at their last Known address.

peter-munk.name: Peter Munk
peter-munk.bio: Hungarian-born Canadian Jewish businessman and philanthropist (1927-2018) who founded Barrick Gold Corporation, the world's largest gold mining company. A Holocaust survivor who escaped Budapest via Kindertransport. Major benefactor of the Peter Munk Cardiac Centre.

affiliations.organization: Munk School of Global Affairs (U of Toronto)

dan-daviau.name: Dan Daviau
dan-daviau.bio: Canadian financial executive. CEO of Canaccord Genuity Group, one of the largest independent investment banks in Canada. Jewish. Oversees wealth management and capital markets operations across North America, the UK, and Australia.

anthony-pratt.name: Anthony Pratt
anthony-pratt.bio: Jewish Australian billionaire, chairman of Visy Industries and Pratt Industries.

harry-oppenheimer.name: Harry Oppenheimer
harry-oppenheimer.bio: South African mining magnate (1908-2000) and former chairman of Anglo American Corporation and De Beers. Son of Ernest Oppenheimer. Continued the family's dominance of the global diamond and gold industries while opposing apartheid from within the business establishment.

donald-gordon.name: Donald Gordon
donald-gordon.bio: South African Jewish businessman (1930-2019) who founded Liberty Holdings, South Africa's second-largest insurance company. Built the Liberty Group into a financial services conglomerate. A major philanthropist who established the Donald Gordon Foundation.

vicky-safra.name: Vicky Safra
vicky-safra.bio: Brazilian-born Greek-Jewish billionaire and philanthropist, widow of banker Edmond Safra. One of the wealthiest women in the world with a fortune exceeding $15 billion from the Safra banking empire. Major supporter of education, healthcare, and Jewish causes.

arkady-volozh.name: Arkady Volozh
arkady-volozh.bio: Kazakhstani-born Israeli-Russian Jewish entrepreneur and co-founder of Yandex, Russia's largest internet company and search engine. Built Yandex into a $12 billion tech giant before departing amid EU sanctions. Now based in Israel.

david-sassoon.name: David Sassoon
david-sassoon.bio: Iraqi-born Baghdadi Jewish merchant prince (1792-1864) who founded the Sassoon trading empire spanning the Indian Ocean. Built a business dynasty from Bombay (Mumbai) that dominated Asian trade routes in textiles, opium, and banking. Known as the "Rothschild of the East."

rabbi-nachman-of-breslov.name: Rabbi Nachman of Breslov
rabbi-nachman-of-breslov.bio: Ukrainian Hasidic master (1772-1810). Born in Medzhybizh, Ukraine, great-grandson of the Baal Shem Tov (founder of Hasidism). Founded the Breslov Hasidic movement. Buried in Uman, Ukraine, where tens of thousands of followers pilgrimage annually on Rosh Hashanah.

chiune-sugihara.name: Chiune Sugihara
chiune-sugihara.bio: Japanese diplomat (1900-1986) who served as Vice Consul in Kaunas, Lithuania. Defied his government to issue over 6,000 transit visas to Jewish refugees in 1940, saving an estimated 10,000 lives. Recognized as Righteous Among the Nations by Yad Vashem in 1985.

houda-nonoo.name: Houda Nonoo
houda-nonoo.bio: Bahraini Jewish diplomat and businesswoman who served as Bahrain's Ambassador to the United States from 2008 to 2013, the first Jewish ambassador from an Arab country. Demonstrated Bahrain's religious tolerance and served as a bridge between Arab and Jewish worlds.

raoul-wallenberg.name: Raoul Wallenberg
raoul-wallenberg.bio: Swedish diplomat (1912-1947?) who saved tens of thousands of Hungarian Jews during the Holocaust through protective passports and safe houses. Arrested by Soviet forces in 1945 and died in Soviet custody. One of the most celebrated rescuers of the Holocaust.

daniel-libeskind.name: Daniel Libeskind
daniel-libeskind.bio: Polish-American Jewish architect known for designing emotionally powerful buildings including the Jewish Museum Berlin, the Imperial War Museum North, and the master plan for the rebuilt World Trade Center site. Born in post-war Poland to Holocaust survivors.

sigmund-freud.name: Sigmund Freud
sigmund-freud.bio: Austrian Jewish neurologist (1856-1939) who founded psychoanalysis and is considered the father of modern psychology. His theories on the unconscious mind, dream interpretation, and sexuality revolutionized Western thought. Fled Vienna to London after the Nazi occupation.

donniel-hartman.name: Donniel Hartman
donniel-hartman.bio: Israeli-American rabbi, philosopher, and president of the Shalom Hartman Institute in Jerusalem. A leading Jewish public intellectual who has shaped discourse on Israeli identity, religious pluralism, and the future of Judaism. Author of multiple influential books.

affiliations.organization: Shalom Hartman Institute of North America

david-ellison.name: David Ellison
david-ellison.bio: David Ellison (Jewish), son of Oracle founder Larry Ellison, founded Skydance Media. Paramount agreed to merge with Skydance in 2024.

steven-mnuchin.name: Steven Mnuchin
steven-mnuchin.bio: Steven Mnuchin (Jewish) was a Goldman Sachs partner before serving as US Treasury Secretary 2017-2021.

affiliations.role: Former Goldman Partner & US Treasury Secretary

max-lousada.name: Max Lousada
max-lousada.bio: British music executive and CEO of Recorded Music for Warner Music Group. Oversees Warner's global record label operations including Atlantic Records and Warner Records. Has led Warner through the streaming revolution and championed diverse artist development.

andrew-viterbi.name: Andrew Viterbi
andrew-viterbi.bio: Andrew Viterbi (Jewish, Italian-born), co-founder of Qualcomm. Invented the Viterbi algorithm used in cellular networks, WiFi, and space communications. The Viterbi School of Engineering at USC bears his name.

ilya-sutskever.name: Ilya Sutskever
ilya-sutskever.bio: Ilya Sutskever (Jewish), born in Russia, raised in Israel. Co-founded OpenAI and was chief scientist. Pioneer of deep learning, student of Geoffrey Hinton. Left OpenAI in 2024 to found Safe Superintelligence Inc.

jacob-blaustein.name: Jacob Blaustein
jacob-blaustein.bio: Industrialist and philanthropist who served as AJC president (1949-1954). Negotiated the historic Blaustein-Ben-Gurion Agreement defining US Jewish-Israel relations.

abraham-foxman.name: Abraham Foxman
abraham-foxman.bio: National Director of the ADL from 1987 to 2015. Holocaust survivor born in Poland, saved by his Catholic nanny during WWII.

amy-spitalnick.name: Amy Spitalnick
amy-spitalnick.bio: CEO of JCPA. Previously served as executive director of Integrity First for America, which won a landmark case against white supremacist organizers of the Charlottesville rally.

marvin-hier.name: Marvin Hier
marvin-hier.bio: Founder and Dean of the Simon Wiesenthal Center since 1977. Rabbi Hier built the organization into a global force for Holocaust remembrance and tolerance education.

rabbi-noah-farkas.name: Rabbi Noah Farkas
rabbi-noah-farkas.bio: President and CEO of the Jewish Federation of Greater Los Angeles since 2021. Previously served as senior rabbi of Valley Beth Shalom.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Federation of Greater Los Angeles

lonnie-nasatir.name: Lonnie Nasatir
lonnie-nasatir.bio: President of the Jewish United Fund and Jewish Federation of Metropolitan Chicago. Previously led Jewish community organizations in Detroit.

affiliations.organization: Jewish United Fund of Metropolitan Chicago

daniel-s-mariaschin.name: Daniel S. Mariaschin
daniel-s-mariaschin.bio: CEO of B'nai B'rith International. Has led the organization's international advocacy, including engagement at the UN and with world leaders.

solomon-schechter.name: Solomon Schechter
solomon-schechter.bio: Romanian-born rabbi and scholar who founded the United Synagogue in 1913 and led JTS. Discovered the Cairo Genizah, one of the greatest manuscript finds in history.

rick-jacobs.name: Rick Jacobs
rick-jacobs.bio: President of the URJ since 2012. Previously senior rabbi of Westchester Reform Temple. Leads the largest Jewish denominational organization in North America.

joseph-soloveitchik.name: Joseph Soloveitchik
joseph-soloveitchik.bio: Known as 'The Rav,' Rabbi Soloveitchik (1903-1993) was the towering intellectual figure of Modern Orthodoxy and trained thousands of RCA rabbis at Yeshiva University.

sally-priesand.name: Sally Priesand
sally-priesand.bio: First woman ordained as a rabbi in America (1972, HUC-JIR). Pioneer who opened the rabbinate to women across all Jewish denominations.

affiliations.role: First Female Rabbi Ordained in America

henrietta-szold.name: Henrietta Szold
henrietta-szold.bio: Founded Hadassah in 1912 and directed Youth Aliyah, rescuing thousands of Jewish children from Nazi Europe. Considered one of the most important women in Jewish and Zionist history.

affiliations.organization: Hadassah, The Women's Zionist Organization of America

abraham-cahan.name: Abraham Cahan
abraham-cahan.bio: Lithuanian-Jewish immigrant (1860-1951) who served as editor of the Forward for 50 years (1903-1951). Under his leadership, the Forward became the largest non-English newspaper in America. A giant of Yiddish journalism and literature.

jacob-landau.name: Jacob Landau
jacob-landau.bio: Founded JTA in 1917, creating the first global Jewish news service. Modeled it on the Associated Press to provide reliable Jewish news worldwide.

norman-podhoretz.name: Norman Podhoretz
norman-podhoretz.bio: Editor of Commentary from 1960-1995. His ideological journey from liberalism to neoconservatism mirrored and influenced a generation of Jewish intellectuals. Author of 'Making It' and 'Breaking Ranks.'

elie-wiesel.name: Elie Wiesel
elie-wiesel.bio: Holocaust survivor, Nobel Peace Prize laureate (1986), author of 'Night,' and co-founder of Moment Magazine. Called the 'messenger to mankind' by the Nobel Committee.

affiliations.organization: Conference on Jewish Material Claims Against Germany (Claims Conference)
Elie Wiesel National Institute for the Study of the Holocaust in Romania

max-weinreich.name: Max Weinreich
max-weinreich.bio: Co-founder of YIVO (1925) and pioneering Yiddish linguist. Author of 'History of the Yiddish Language.' Coined the phrase 'a language is a dialect with an army and a navy.'

haskel-lookstein.name: Haskel Lookstein
haskel-lookstein.bio: Senior rabbi of Kehilath Jeshurun for decades. Led the Modern Orthodox movement in NYC. Converted Ivanka Trump to Judaism. Principal of the Ramaz School.

yuli-edelstein.name: Yuli Edelstein
yuli-edelstein.bio: Former Speaker of the Knesset (2013-2020). Born in Ukraine, was a Prisoner of Zion in the Soviet Union before making aliyah. Represented Likud.

meir-dagan.name: Meir Dagan
meir-dagan.bio: Director of the Mossad (2002-2011). Widely credited with reinvigorating Mossad's operational capabilities. Oversaw operations including efforts to sabotage Iran's nuclear program.

affiliations.organization: Mossad (Institute for Intelligence and Special Operations)

sir-mick-davis.name: Sir Mick Davis
sir-mick-davis.bio: Sir Mick Davis, South African-born British businessman (Jewish), former CEO of Xstrata mining, served as chairman of the Jewish Leadership Council and CEO of the UK Conservative Party.

sir-hermann-gollancz.name: Sir Hermann Gollancz
sir-hermann-gollancz.bio: Sir Hermann Gollancz (Jewish), rabbi and scholar, was a prominent leader in the United Synagogue movement in the early 20th century.

michael-goldstein.name: Michael Goldstein
michael-goldstein.bio: Michael Goldstein served as president of the United Synagogue, overseeing modernization efforts.

clive-lawton.name: Clive Lawton
clive-lawton.bio: Clive Lawton OBE (Jewish), educator and communal leader, was a co-founder of Limmud in 1980 and helped establish it as an international Jewish learning movement.

lord-levy.name: Lord Levy
lord-levy.bio: Lord Michael Levy (Jewish), Labour Party fundraiser and life peer, has served as president of Jewish Care and is one of its principal supporters.

sir-moses-montefiore.name: Sir Moses Montefiore
sir-moses-montefiore.bio: Sir Moses Montefiore (Jewish, 1784-1885), British financier, philanthropist, and Sheriff of London, was a pioneering figure in Jewish humanitarian relief efforts from Britain.

leopold-greenberg.name: Leopold Greenberg
leopold-greenberg.bio: Leopold Greenberg (Jewish, 1861-1931), editor of the Jewish Chronicle for 26 years, was a key Zionist leader and confidant of Theodor Herzl.

justin-cohen.name: Justin Cohen
justin-cohen.bio: Justin Cohen (Jewish), journalist and editor, has served as a senior editorial figure at the Jewish News, shaping its coverage of Anglo-Jewish affairs.

jonathan-boyd.name: Jonathan Boyd
jonathan-boyd.bio: Jonathan Boyd (Jewish), executive director of JPR, leads the institute's research programs on European Jewish demographics, identity, and antisemitism.

rabbi-leo-baeck.name: Rabbi Leo Baeck
rabbi-leo-baeck.bio: Rabbi Leo Baeck (Jewish, 1873-1956), German rabbi, theologian, and leader of Progressive Judaism, led the Reich Association of German Jews under Nazi rule and survived Theresienstadt concentration camp.

moses-angel.name: Moses Angel
moses-angel.bio: Moses Angel (Jewish, 1819-1898), headmaster of Jews' Free School for 50 years (1842-1897), transformed it into one of the largest schools in England with over 4,000 pupils.

alfred-wiener.name: Alfred Wiener
alfred-wiener.bio: Dr. Alfred Wiener (Jewish, 1885-1964), German-born librarian and activist, founded the Wiener Library in Amsterdam in 1933 to document Nazi antisemitism. The collection was moved to London in 1939 and used as evidence at Nuremberg.

sir-trevor-pears.name: Sir Trevor Pears
sir-trevor-pears.bio: Sir Trevor Pears CMG (Jewish), executive chair of the Pears Foundation and director of the William Pears Group property business, is one of the UK's leading Jewish philanthropists.

avi-shaked.name: Avi Shaked
avi-shaked.bio: Avi Shaked (Jewish, Israeli), co-founder of 888 Holdings, helped build one of the world's largest online gambling platforms from its origins in Israel.

sir-nicholas-winton.name: Sir Nicholas Winton
sir-nicholas-winton.bio: Sir Nicholas Winton (1909-2015), British humanitarian, organized the rescue of 669 mostly Jewish children from Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia via the Kindertransport. His efforts were unknown until 1988.

francis-kalifat.name: Francis Kalifat
francis-kalifat.bio: Francis Kalifat (Jewish, French), served as president of CRIF, leading its advocacy against antisemitism and efforts to strengthen France-Israel relations.

affiliations.organization: CRIF (Conseil Représentatif des Institutions Juives de France)

grand-rabbi-ha-m-korsia.name: Grand Rabbi Haïm Korsia
grand-rabbi-ha-m-korsia.bio: Grand Rabbi Haïm Korsia (Jewish, born 1963), Chief Rabbi of France since 2014, represents French Jewry in interfaith and public affairs. Previously served as chaplain general of the French armed forces.

adolphe-cr-mieux.name: Adolphe Crémieux
adolphe-cr-mieux.bio: Adolphe Crémieux (Jewish, 1796-1880), French lawyer and statesman, co-founded the Alliance Israélite Universelle in 1860 and authored the Crémieux Decree granting French citizenship to Algerian Jews.

emmanuel-levinas.name: Emmanuel Levinas
emmanuel-levinas.bio: Emmanuel Levinas (Jewish, 1906-1995), Lithuanian-born French philosopher, was one of the most influential thinkers of the 20th century. His work on ethics, alterity, and the Talmud transformed Continental philosophy.

shimon-koffler-fogel.name: Shimon Koffler Fogel
shimon-koffler-fogel.bio: Shimon Koffler Fogel (Jewish), CEO of CIJA, has led the organization's advocacy efforts on behalf of the Canadian Jewish community, engaging with government and media.

affiliations.organization: Centre for Israel and Jewish Affairs (CIJA)
Centre for Israel and Jewish Affairs

avi-benlolo.name: Avi Benlolo
avi-benlolo.bio: Avi Benlolo (Jewish), founding president and CEO of Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center for Holocaust Studies in Canada, led its growth into a major Holocaust education organization.

samuel-bronfman.name: Samuel Bronfman
samuel-bronfman.bio: Samuel Bronfman (Jewish, 1889-1971), founder of Seagram, served as president of the Canadian Jewish Congress for decades, using his wealth and influence to advance Jewish communal interests in Canada.

alex-ryvchin.name: Alex Ryvchin
alex-ryvchin.bio: Alex Ryvchin (Jewish), co-CEO of the ECAJ, is a prominent advocate for the Australian Jewish community and author of books on antisemitism and Zionism.

colin-rubenstein.name: Colin Rubenstein
colin-rubenstein.bio: Dr. Colin Rubenstein AM (Jewish), executive director of AIJAC, has led the organization for decades and is one of Australia's most prominent advocates for Israel and the Jewish community.

peter-eisenman.name: Peter Eisenman
peter-eisenman.bio: Peter Eisenman (Jewish, born 1932), American architect and theorist, designed Berlin's Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe. Known for his deconstructivist approach and intellectually challenging architectural designs.

affiliations.organization: Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe

yuri-kanner.name: Yuri Kanner
yuri-kanner.bio: Yuri Kanner (Jewish, Russian), president of the Russian Jewish Congress, leads efforts to promote Jewish cultural life, fight antisemitism, and strengthen Jewish identity in Russia.

wendy-kahn.name: Wendy Kahn
wendy-kahn.bio: Wendy Kahn (Jewish), national director of the SAJBD, leads the organization's advocacy, community relations, and anti-antisemitism efforts in South Africa.

affiliations.organization: South African Jewish Board of Deputies (SAJBD)

bernard-gillian-memory-gilligan.name: Bernard Gillian Memory Gilligan
bernard-gillian-memory-gilligan.bio: Jewish South African entrepreneurs founded Investec in 1974, which grew into a major international banking group.

rabbi-gavriel-holtzberg.name: Rabbi Gavriel Holtzberg
rabbi-gavriel-holtzberg.bio: Rabbi Gavriel Holtzberg (Jewish, Israeli, 1979-2008) and his wife Rivka ran Chabad Nariman House in Mumbai. Both were murdered during the 2008 Mumbai terrorist attacks.

alberto-nisman.name: Alberto Nisman
alberto-nisman.bio: Alberto Nisman (Jewish, 1963-2015), Argentine prosecutor, investigated the AMIA bombing for 10 years. Found dead with a gunshot wound in 2015, hours before he was to present evidence that President Cristina Kirchner covered up Iranian involvement.

rabbi-marshall-t-meyer.name: Rabbi Marshall T. Meyer
rabbi-marshall-t-meyer.bio: Rabbi Marshall T. Meyer (Jewish, American, 1930-1993), founder of the Seminario Rabínico Latinoamericano, heroically defended human rights during Argentina's military dictatorship (1976-1983), visiting political prisoners and documenting abuses.

xavier-l-pez-ancona.name: Xavier López Ancona
xavier-l-pez-ancona.bio: Xavier López Ancona (Jewish, Mexican), founder and chairman of KidZania, created one of the most innovative children's entertainment concepts, expanding from Mexico City to 25+ locations worldwide.

oskar-deutsch.name: Oskar Deutsch
oskar-deutsch.bio: Oskar Deutsch (Jewish), president of the IKG Wien, leads the Vienna Jewish community and advocates for Jewish interests in Austrian public life.

affiliations.organization: Israelitische Kultusgemeinde Wien (Jewish Community of Vienna)

anne-frank.name: Anne Frank
anne-frank.bio: Anne Frank (Jewish, 1929-1945), born in Frankfurt, fled with her family to Amsterdam. Hid for two years and wrote her famous diary before being discovered. Died in Bergen-Belsen. Her diary became one of the most-read books in history.

klara-ko-odziejska-deg-rska.name: Klara Kołodziejska-Degórska
klara-ko-odziejska-deg-rska.bio: Chief Rabbi of Poland (Progressive), one of the first female rabbis in Polish history.

affiliations.organization: Union of Jewish Communities in Poland

barbara-kirshenblatt-gimblett.name: Barbara Kirshenblatt-Gimblett
barbara-kirshenblatt-gimblett.bio: Professor at NYU who designed POLIN Museum's core exhibition on 1,000 years of Polish Jewish history.

affiliations.organization: POLIN Museum of the History of Polish Jews

piotr-cywi-ski.name: Piotr Cywiński
piotr-cywi-ski.bio: Director of the Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial and Museum since 2006. Oversees preservation and education programs.

jonathan-ornstein.name: Jonathan Ornstein
jonathan-ornstein.bio: American-born executive director of the JCC Kraków since 2008, credited with revitalizing Jewish life in the city.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Community Centre of Krakow (JCC Kraków)
Jewish Community Centre of Kraków (JCC Kraków)

petr-papou-ek.name: Petr Papoušek
petr-papou-ek.bio: President of the Federation of Jewish Communities in the Czech Republic, leading community development and interfaith dialogue.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in the Czech Republic

gennadiy-bogolubov.name: Gennadiy Bogolubov
gennadiy-bogolubov.bio: Ukrainian-Jewish billionaire, co-owner of PrivatBank, who funded the construction of the Menorah Center in Dnipro.

isak-haleva.name: Isak Haleva
isak-haleva.bio: Chief Rabbi (Hakham Bashi) of Turkey since 2002, leading the Sephardic Jewish community.

andr-azoulay.name: André Azoulay
andr-azoulay.bio: Jewish Moroccan businessman and senior adviser to King Mohammed VI and his father Hassan II, promoting interfaith dialogue and Moroccan-Israeli relations.

affiliations.organization: Council of Jewish Communities of Morocco

ross-kriel.name: Ross Kriel
ross-kriel.bio: South African-born businessman who has led the development of organized Jewish community life in the UAE.

david-marshall.name: David Marshall
david-marshall.bio: Singapore's first Chief Minister (1955-1956), a Sephardic Jew from a Baghdadi Jewish family who played a crucial role in Singapore's path to independence.

marc-baker.name: Marc Baker
marc-baker.bio: President and CEO of Combined Jewish Philanthropies, one of the largest Jewish federations in North America.

jacob-blumenthal.name: Jacob Blumenthal
jacob-blumenthal.bio: CEO of the Rabbinical Assembly, the international association of Conservative/Masorti rabbis.

andrew-rehfeld.name: Andrew Rehfeld
andrew-rehfeld.bio: President of Hebrew Union College-Jewish Institute of Religion, the seminary for Reform Judaism.

affiliations.organization: Hebrew Union College - Jewish Institute of Religion

isaac-mayer-wise.name: Isaac Mayer Wise
isaac-mayer-wise.bio: Founder of Hebrew Union College (1875), the Union of American Hebrew Congregations, and the Central Conference of American Rabbis. Father of American Reform Judaism.

affiliations.organization: Hebrew Union College - Jewish Institute of Religion

howard-hyman.name: Howard Hyman
howard-hyman.bio: National director of ORT America, the US affiliate of World ORT's global education network.

jack-h-skirball.name: Jack H. Skirball
jack-h-skirball.bio: Jewish-American rabbi and film producer (1896-1985) who established the Skirball Cultural Center. Produced the film "Saboteur" with Alfred Hitchcock. His foundation funded the cultural center that opened after his death.

ivy-barsky.name: Ivy Barsky
ivy-barsky.bio: Former CEO and Gwen Goodman Director of the National Museum of American Jewish History in Philadelphia.

affiliations.organization: National Museum of American Jewish History

claudia-gould.name: Claudia Gould
claudia-gould.bio: Helen Goldsmith Menschel Director of The Jewish Museum, overseeing its renowned collection of Jewish art and culture.

bernard-michael.name: Bernard Michael
bernard-michael.bio: President of the Center for Jewish History, which houses five major Jewish historical organizations in NYC.

warren-buffett.name: Warren Buffett
warren-buffett.bio: Chairman and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway. While not Jewish himself, Buffett has deep ties to Jewish business figures and is a major supporter of Israel.

ajit-jain.name: Ajit Jain
ajit-jain.bio: Vice Chairman of Insurance Operations at Berkshire Hathaway. One of Berkshire's key leaders.

dennis-charney.name: Dennis Charney
dennis-charney.bio: Dean of Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai (Jewish), leading neuroscientist and researcher.

kenneth-davis.name: Kenneth Davis
kenneth-davis.bio: CEO of Mount Sinai Health System, building it into one of America's largest academic medical systems.

thomas-priselac.name: Thomas Priselac
thomas-priselac.bio: President and CEO of Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, one of the largest non-profit hospitals in the Western US.

gordon-bhatt.name: Gordon Bhatt
gordon-bhatt.bio: Indian community leader who has played an active role in organizing and supporting the small Jewish community in India. Works to preserve the heritage and traditions of India's diverse Jewish populations including Bene Israel and Cochin Jews.

brad-karp.name: Brad Karp
brad-karp.bio: Chairman of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison (Jewish), one of the most prominent corporate lawyers in America.

david-greenwald.name: David Greenwald
david-greenwald.bio: Chairman of Fried Frank (Jewish), a major international law firm founded by Jewish lawyers.

richard-rosenbaum.name: Richard Rosenbaum
richard-rosenbaum.bio: Executive Chairman of Greenberg Traurig (Jewish), one of the world's largest law firms with 2,700+ attorneys.

joseph-m-proskauer.name: Joseph M. Proskauer
joseph-m-proskauer.bio: Co-founder of Proskauer Rose (Jewish), served as president of the American Jewish Committee from 1943-1949.

alan-waldenberg.name: Alan Waldenberg
alan-waldenberg.bio: Managing partner of Schulte Roth & Zabel (Jewish), a leading law firm specializing in investment management.

charles-kaye.name: Charles Kaye
charles-kaye.bio: Co-CEO of Warburg Pincus (Jewish), one of the largest global growth equity firms.

eric-warburg.name: Eric Warburg
eric-warburg.bio: German-American banker (Jewish) whose family's name is on the firm. The Warburgs were one of Europe's most prominent banking dynasties.

joshua-bekenstein.name: Joshua Bekenstein
joshua-bekenstein.bio: Co-Chairman of Bain Capital (Jewish), a leading global private investment firm managing over $175 billion.

ray-dalio.name: Ray Dalio
ray-dalio.bio: American billionaire investor. Founder of Bridgewater Associates, the world's largest hedge fund. Pioneer of risk parity investing. Author of "Principles." Born to an Italian-American family in Queens, has invested significantly in Israel.

david-blitzer.name: David Blitzer
david-blitzer.bio: Co-owner of the 76ers (Jewish), Blackstone executive, and owner of multiple sports teams globally.

richard-haass.name: Richard Haass
richard-haass.bio: President of CFR (2003-2023) (Jewish), prominent foreign policy advisor and author.

robert-doar.name: Robert Doar
robert-doar.bio: American policy expert and president of the American Enterprise Institute (AEI), a leading conservative think tank. Previously served as Commissioner of Social Services for New York City under Mayor Bloomberg. Focused on poverty, welfare, and workforce policy.

john-walters.name: John Walters
john-walters.bio: President of Hudson Institute, a conservative think tank on national security and foreign policy.

michael-makovsky.name: Michael Makovsky
michael-makovsky.bio: President and CEO of JINSA (Jewish), advocating for a strong US-Israel strategic alliance.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Institute for National Security of America (JINSA)

eric-yuan.name: Eric Yuan
eric-yuan.bio: Founder and CEO of Zoom. While Yuan is not Jewish, the company has significant connections to Israeli tech talent.

patrick-collison.name: Patrick Collison
patrick-collison.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Stripe. While the Collison brothers are Irish, Stripe's payments infrastructure connects to major Jewish-led businesses.

samuel-irving-newhouse-jr.name: Samuel Irving Newhouse Jr.
samuel-irving-newhouse-jr.bio: Former chairman of Condé Nast (Jewish), overseeing Vogue, The New Yorker, Vanity Fair, and GQ. Newhouse family built one of America's largest media empires.

fred-ryan.name: Fred Ryan
fred-ryan.bio: Former publisher of The Washington Post. The paper was owned by the Meyer-Graham family (Jewish) for 80 years before Amazon's Jeff Bezos purchased it.

jim-joseph.name: Jim Joseph
jim-joseph.bio: Jewish-American businessman and philanthropist whose $500+ million estate created one of the largest foundations focused on Jewish education.

meir-soloveichik.name: Meir Soloveichik
meir-soloveichik.bio: Rabbi and scholar associated with the Maimonides Fund's mission of Jewish education and scholarship.

roger-hertog.name: Roger Hertog
roger-hertog.bio: Co-founder of the Tikva Fund (Jewish), supporting Jewish and Zionist intellectual life and education.

steven-a-fox.name: Steven A. Fox
steven-a-fox.bio: National director of Friends of the IDF, raising hundreds of millions for IDF soldier welfare.

affiliations.organization: Friends of the IDF (FIDF) - additional chapters

scott-feltman.name: Scott Feltman
scott-feltman.bio: American Jewish community leader who has served in positions advocating for Jewish values and interfaith dialogue. Active in American Jewish organizational life and community building.

andr-s-spokoiny.name: Andrés Spokoiny
andr-s-spokoiny.bio: President and CEO of Jewish Funders Network (Argentinian-born), convening Jewish philanthropists globally.

catherine-reed.name: Catherine Reed
catherine-reed.bio: CEO of American Friends of Magen David Adom, supporting Israel's national emergency medical service.

st-phane-bancel.name: Stéphane Bancel
st-phane-bancel.bio: CEO of Moderna, which developed one of the first COVID-19 mRNA vaccines. While Bancel is French, Moderna's chief medical officer Tal Zaks (Jewish, Israeli) played a key role.

michael-pearson.name: Michael Pearson
michael-pearson.bio: Former CEO who transformed Valeant through aggressive acquisition. The company later rebranded to Bausch Health.

uday-baldota.name: Uday Baldota
uday-baldota.bio: CEO of Taro Pharmaceutical Industries, an Israeli-founded pharmaceutical company now a subsidiary of Sun Pharma.

kenneth-gibbs.name: Kenneth Gibbs
kenneth-gibbs.bio: President and CEO of Maimonides Medical Center in Brooklyn, named after the medieval Jewish philosopher Moses Maimonides.

philip-ozuah.name: Philip Ozuah
philip-ozuah.bio: President and CEO of Montefiore Medicine, named after Sir Moses Montefiore, the Jewish philanthropist.

joshua-davidson.name: Joshua Davidson
joshua-davidson.bio: Senior rabbi of Temple Emanu-El (Jewish), the largest Reform synagogue in the world, located on Fifth Avenue.

rachel-timoner.name: Rachel Timoner
rachel-timoner.bio: Senior rabbi of Congregation Beth Elohim (Jewish), a historic Reform congregation in Brooklyn.

steve-leder.name: Steve Leder
steve-leder.bio: Senior rabbi of Wilshire Boulevard Temple (Jewish), one of the oldest synagogues in Los Angeles, founded in 1862.

peter-stein.name: Peter Stein
peter-stein.bio: The Touro Synagogue (1763) is the oldest surviving synagogue in the US. George Washington wrote his famous letter on religious freedom to its congregation.

mordecai-kaplan.name: Mordecai Kaplan
mordecai-kaplan.bio: Co-founded the Young Israel movement (1912) as a Modern Orthodox effort to make Judaism relevant to American youth. Later founded Reconstructionist Judaism.

tully-harcsztark.name: Tully Harcsztark
tully-harcsztark.bio: Founding principal of SAR High School (Jewish), known for academic excellence and Modern Orthodox education in Riverdale, NY.

joseph-lookstein.name: Joseph Lookstein
joseph-lookstein.bio: Rabbi Joseph Lookstein (Jewish) founded Ramaz School in 1937 on Manhattan's Upper East Side; his family led it for decades.

abraham-joshua-heschel.name: Abraham Joshua Heschel
abraham-joshua-heschel.bio: Rabbi Abraham Joshua Heschel (1907-1972), one of the leading Jewish theologians of the 20th century, civil rights activist who marched with MLK in Selma.

charles-e-smith.name: Charles E. Smith
charles-e-smith.bio: Jewish-American real estate magnate in Washington, DC, whose philanthropy funded the school and other Jewish institutions.

affiliations.organization: Charles E. Smith Jewish Day School (DC)

moshe-davis.name: Moshe Davis
moshe-davis.bio: Jewish scholar and educator who helped establish the Camp Ramah network as a vehicle for Conservative Jewish camping education.

robert-bildner.name: Robert Bildner
robert-bildner.bio: Supporter and leader in Young Judaea, the Zionist youth movement that operates Camp Young Judaea.

dov-behr-manischewitz.name: Dov Behr Manischewitz
dov-behr-manischewitz.bio: Founded the Manischewitz Company in 1888 in Cincinnati, Ohio. It became the world's largest matzo manufacturer.

tuvia-sapir.name: Tuvia Sapir
tuvia-sapir.bio: Israeli-American businessman involved in food ventures. Sabra is a joint venture between PepsiCo and Strauss Group (Israel).

eli-cohen.name: Eli Cohen
eli-cohen.bio: Israeli politician who served as Minister of Foreign Affairs. The ministry manages Israel's diplomatic relations with over 150 countries.

eran-yaakov.name: Eran Yaakov
eran-yaakov.bio: Commissioner of the Israel Tax Authority, overseeing tax collection for the State of Israel.

yaakov-kvint.name: Yaakov Kvint
yaakov-kvint.bio: Israeli rabbi and community leader who has served as chief rabbi in various European Jewish communities. Played a role in revitalizing Jewish life in the former Soviet Union. An advocate for Orthodox outreach and Jewish identity strengthening.

hagai-topolansky.name: Hagai Topolansky
hagai-topolansky.bio: Director General of the Israel Airports Authority, overseeing Ben Gurion Airport and other Israeli airports.

daniel-chamovitz.name: Daniel Chamovitz
daniel-chamovitz.bio: President of Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, named after Israel's founding prime minister David Ben-Gurion.

ron-robin.name: Ron Robin
ron-robin.bio: President of the University of Haifa, Israel's most diverse university with significant Arab student enrollment.

uriel-reichman.name: Uriel Reichman
uriel-reichman.bio: Founder and president of Reichman University (formerly IDC Herzliya), Israel's first private university.

boris-schatz.name: Boris Schatz
boris-schatz.bio: Founded Bezalel Academy in 1906 in Jerusalem, making it Israel's oldest art institution. Named after the biblical artisan Bezalel.

affiliations.organization: Bezalel Academy of Arts and Design

k-re-schultz.name: Kåre Schultz
k-re-schultz.bio: Former President and CEO of Teva Pharmaceutical Industries, the world's largest generic drug manufacturer, headquartered in Tel Aviv.

barak-eilam.name: Barak Eilam
barak-eilam.bio: CEO of NICE Ltd (Jewish, Israeli), a global leader in cloud and on-premises enterprise software and AI.

bezhalel-machlis.name: Bezhalel Machlis
bezhalel-machlis.bio: President and CEO of Elbit Systems (Jewish), Israel's largest publicly traded defense company.

boaz-levy.name: Boaz Levy
boaz-levy.bio: President and CEO of Israel Aerospace Industries, Israel's largest defense and aerospace manufacturer.

yoav-har-even.name: Yoav Har-Even
yoav-har-even.bio: President and CEO of Rafael Advanced Defense Systems, developer of Iron Dome, David's Sling, and Trophy defense systems.

avi-felder.name: Avi Felder
avi-felder.bio: Former CEO of IMI Systems (now merged with Elbit), Israel's munitions and military technology developer.

russell-ellwanger.name: Russell Ellwanger
russell-ellwanger.bio: CEO of Tower Semiconductor (Jewish), a leading foundry specializing in analog semiconductor manufacturing.

omer-kaplan.name: Omer Kaplan
omer-kaplan.bio: Co-founder of ironSource (Jewish, Israeli), the app monetization platform that merged with Unity Technologies in 2022.

robert-antokol.name: Robert Antokol
robert-antokol.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Playtika (Jewish, Israeli), a leading mobile gaming company acquired by a Chinese consortium for $4.4B.

raviv-zoller.name: Raviv Zoller
raviv-zoller.bio: President and CEO of ICL Group (Jewish), a global specialty minerals company based on Dead Sea resources.

dov-kotler.name: Dov Kotler
dov-kotler.bio: Israeli banker and CEO of Bank Hapoalim, Israel's largest bank. Led the bank through a major restructuring and settlement of US tax evasion charges. Has modernized the bank's digital services and expanded its international operations.

hanan-friedman.name: Hanan Friedman
hanan-friedman.bio: President and CEO of Bank Leumi (Jewish), Israel's oldest bank, founded in 1902 as the Anglo-Palestine Company.

uri-levin.name: Uri Levin
uri-levin.bio: President and CEO of Israel Discount Bank, the third-largest banking group in Israel.

dina-ben-tal-ganancia.name: Dina Ben Tal Ganancia
dina-ben-tal-ganancia.bio: CEO of El Al Israel Airlines, Israel's national carrier, known for strict security and not flying on Shabbat.

ofra-strauss.name: Ofra Strauss
ofra-strauss.bio: Chairwoman of Strauss Group (Jewish), one of Israel's largest food and beverage companies. Granddaughter of founders Richard and Hilda Strauss.

eyal-malis.name: Eyal Malis
eyal-malis.bio: CEO of Tnuva, Israel's largest food manufacturer, controlling approximately 70% of the Israeli dairy market. Acquired by Bright Food (China) in 2014.

avi-ben-assayag.name: Avi Ben Assayag
avi-ben-assayag.bio: CEO of Osem-Nestlé Israel, one of Israel's largest food manufacturers and a subsidiary of Nestlé since 2016.

yaakov-katz.name: Yaakov Katz
yaakov-katz.bio: Editor-in-chief of The Jerusalem Post (Jewish), Israel's leading English-language daily newspaper.

frank-melloul.name: Frank Melloul
frank-melloul.bio: CEO and chairman of i24NEWS (Jewish), Israel's international 24/7 news channel broadcasting in English, French, and Arabic.

ido-bruno.name: Ido Bruno
ido-bruno.bio: Director of the Israel Museum in Jerusalem, which houses the Dead Sea Scrolls in the Shrine of the Book.

tania-coen-uzzielli.name: Tania Coen-Uzzielli
tania-coen-uzzielli.bio: Director of the Tel Aviv Museum of Art, one of Israel's leading art museums with extensive Israeli and international collections.

zubin-mehta.name: Zubin Mehta
zubin-mehta.bio: Indian-born conductor who served as Music Director of the Israel Philharmonic Orchestra for nearly 50 years (1969-2019), a deeply beloved figure.

nahum-zemach.name: Nahum Zemach
nahum-zemach.bio: Founded Habima Theatre in Moscow in 1917 as the first Hebrew-language theater. It moved to British Mandate Palestine in 1928.

theodor-herzl.name: Theodor Herzl
theodor-herzl.bio: Austro-Hungarian journalist and political activist (1860-1904). Born in Budapest to an assimilated Jewish family. Father of modern political Zionism. Author of "Der Judenstaat" (The Jewish State, 1896). Founded the World Zionist Organization at the First Zionist Congress in Basel (1897).

tomer-bar-zeev.name: Tomer Bar-Zeev
tomer-bar-zeev.bio: Co-founder and CEO of ironSource (Jewish, Israeli), which merged with Unity Technologies in a $4.4B deal in 2022.

yaki-faitelson.name: Yaki Faitelson
yaki-faitelson.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Varonis Systems (Jewish, Israeli), a cybersecurity company specializing in data security and analytics.

oren-kaniel.name: Oren Kaniel
oren-kaniel.bio: Co-founder and CEO of AppsFlyer (Jewish, Israeli), a mobile attribution and marketing analytics platform.

yossi-carmil.name: Yossi Carmil
yossi-carmil.bio: CEO of Cellebrite (Jewish), an Israeli digital forensics company whose tools are used by law enforcement worldwide.

eitan-achlow.name: Eitan Achlow
eitan-achlow.bio: Co-founder of Candiru (Saito Tech), an Israeli cyber-intelligence firm selling surveillance tools to governments.

dan-bodner.name: Dan Bodner
dan-bodner.bio: CEO of Verint Systems (Jewish, Israeli-born), a cybersecurity and intelligence company spun off from Comverse Technology.

shuky-sheffer.name: Shuky Sheffer
shuky-sheffer.bio: President and CEO of Amdocs (Jewish, Israeli-founded), a leading IT services and software company serving communications industry.

roni-al-dor.name: Roni Al-Dor
roni-al-dor.bio: President and CEO of Sapiens International (Jewish), a software company serving the insurance industry globally.

avraham-ophir.name: Avraham Ophir
avraham-ophir.bio: Executive at IDE Technologies (Jewish), a world leader in desalination and industrial water treatment, co-owned by ICL and Delek.

avraham-duvdevani.name: Avraham Duvdevani
avraham-duvdevani.bio: World Chairman of KKL-JNF, which has planted over 250 million trees in Israel and manages 170,000 acres of land.

affiliations.organization: Jewish National Fund - Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael (KKL-JNF)

michael-steinhardt.name: Michael Steinhardt
michael-steinhardt.bio: American financier and philanthropist. Pioneer hedge fund manager. Co-founder of Birthright Israel with Charles Bronfman. Resigned from multiple Jewish organizational boards in 2019 after allegations of sexual harassment.

dror-bin.name: Dror Bin
dror-bin.bio: CEO of the Israel Innovation Authority, overseeing Israel's innovation policy and support for R&D.

eugene-kandel.name: Eugene Kandel
eugene-kandel.bio: CEO of Start-Up Nation Central (Jewish), an organization mapping and promoting Israel's tech ecosystem.

nadav-zafrir.name: Nadav Zafrir
nadav-zafrir.bio: Former commander of Unit 8200 (Jewish) and co-founder of Team8, a cybersecurity think tank. Unit 8200 alumni have founded many top tech companies.

felix-dothan.name: Felix Dothan
felix-dothan.bio: One of the original architects of the Talpiot program (Jewish), the IDF's elite academic-military program for top recruits.

ilana-dayan.name: Ilana Dayan
ilana-dayan.bio: Israeli journalist (Jewish) who presented on Galei Zahal before becoming one of Israel's most prominent investigative journalists.

ilan-yeshua.name: Ilan Yeshua
ilan-yeshua.bio: Former CEO of Walla! News, an Israeli news and content portal. Testified in the Netanyahu corruption trial (Case 4000).

saul-singer.name: Saul Singer
saul-singer.bio: Co-author of 'Start-Up Nation' (Jewish), the bestselling book that popularized Israel's reputation as a global tech powerhouse.

shmuel-rabinovitch.name: Shmuel Rabinovitch
shmuel-rabinovitch.bio: Rabbi of the Western Wall (Jewish), overseeing the holiest site where Jews can pray, visited by millions annually.

sheikh-muhammad-ahmad-hussein.name: Sheikh Muhammad Ahmad Hussein
sheikh-muhammad-ahmad-hussein.bio: Grand Mufti of Jerusalem, overseeing the Islamic Waqf's administration of the Temple Mount/Haram al-Sharif compound.

yigael-yadin.name: Yigael Yadin
yigael-yadin.bio: Israeli archaeologist and politician (Jewish) who led the famous excavations of Masada (1963-1965), uncovering the Zealot fortress.

theophilos-iii.name: Theophilos III
theophilos-iii.bio: Greek Orthodox Patriarch of Jerusalem, co-custodian of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre alongside Catholic and Armenian churches.

herod-the-great.name: Herod the Great
herod-the-great.bio: King Herod (Jewish, Idumean) built the monumental structure over the Cave of the Patriarchs in Hebron approximately 2,000 years ago.

gerald-ronson.name: Gerald Ronson
gerald-ronson.bio: Jewish-British businessman and property developer, long-time supporter and co-president of the Community Security Trust.

judy-ironside.name: Judy Ironside
judy-ironside.bio: Founder of the UK Jewish Film Festival, showcasing Jewish-themed cinema since 1997.

raphael-zarum.name: Raphael Zarum
raphael-zarum.bio: Dean of the London School of Jewish Studies (Jewish), a leading center for Jewish education and scholarship in the UK.

nathan-marcus-adler.name: Nathan Marcus Adler
nathan-marcus-adler.bio: Chief Rabbi who founded Jews' College in 1856 as a seminary for training Orthodox rabbis in England.

edward-isaacs.name: Edward Isaacs
edward-isaacs.bio: President of the Union of Jewish Students, representing Jewish students across UK and Ireland campuses.

mayer-amschel-rothschild.name: Mayer Amschel Rothschild
mayer-amschel-rothschild.bio: Founded the Rothschild banking dynasty in Frankfurt in the 18th century, whose descendants became the most influential Jewish family in European history.

max-dunbar.name: Max Dunbar
max-dunbar.bio: CEO of Manchester Jewish Museum, housed in a restored 1874 Spanish and Portuguese synagogue.

abigail-morris.name: Abigail Morris
abigail-morris.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum London, exploring Jewish life, history, and identity in Britain since 1932.

moses-de-medina.name: Moses de Medina
moses-de-medina.bio: Key figure in establishing Bevis Marks Synagogue (1701), the oldest synagogue in Britain still in use.

simone-veil.name: Simone Veil
simone-veil.bio: Holocaust survivor (Jewish, French), first president of the Fondation pour la Mémoire de la Shoah, and first president of the European Parliament.

affiliations.organization: Fondation pour la Mémoire de la Shoah

sammy-ghozlan.name: Sammy Ghozlan
sammy-ghozlan.bio: Founder and former president of SPCJ (Jewish), providing security services for French Jewish institutions.

affiliations.organization: Bureau National de Vigilance Contre l'Antisémitisme (BNVCA)
SPCJ (Service de Protection de la Communauté Juive)

jacques-fredj.name: Jacques Fredj
jacques-fredj.bio: Director of the Mémorial de la Shoah in Paris (Jewish), Europe's largest Holocaust documentation center.

andr-e-salomon.name: Andrée Salomon
andr-e-salomon.bio: OSE leader (Jewish) who organized the rescue of hundreds of Jewish children in France during WWII.

samuel-lejoyeux.name: Samuel Lejoyeux
samuel-lejoyeux.bio: Former president of UEJF, France's Jewish student union fighting antisemitism on campuses.

affiliations.organization: UEJF (Union of Jewish Students of France)
Union des Étudiants Juifs de France (UEJF)

emmanuel-rials.name: Emmanuel Rials
emmanuel-rials.bio: Director of Radio J, France's leading Jewish radio station serving the largest Jewish community in Europe.

ariel-goldmann.name: Ariel Goldmann
ariel-goldmann.bio: President of the FSJU (Jewish), funding social programs for France's 450,000+ Jewish community.

zadoc-kahn.name: Zadoc Kahn
zadoc-kahn.bio: Grand Rabbi of France (1889-1905, Jewish) who was based at the Grand Synagogue of Paris (La Victoire).

nicolas-dufourcq.name: Nicolas Dufourcq
nicolas-dufourcq.bio: CEO of Bpifrance, the French public investment bank supporting French-Israeli business partnerships.

claude-hampel.name: Claude Hampel
claude-hampel.bio: President of Keren Hayesod France, raising funds for Israel across the French Jewish community.

sophie-bellon.name: Sophie Bellon
sophie-bellon.bio: Chairwoman and CEO of Sodexo, the French multinational food services company with operations in Israel.

ha-m-korsia.name: Haïm Korsia
ha-m-korsia.bio: Grand Rabbi of France (Jewish), based at the Grand Synagogue of Paris. Elected in 2014.

annette-wieviorka.name: Annette Wieviorka
annette-wieviorka.bio: French-Jewish historian specializing in the Holocaust, who has written extensively about Drancy where 67,000 Jews were interned.

nikki-holland.name: Nikki Holland
nikki-holland.bio: CEO of Jewish Federations of Canada - UIA, the national umbrella for Canadian Jewish community organizations.

yoni-goldstein.name: Yoni Goldstein
yoni-goldstein.bio: Editor of the Canadian Jewish News, Canada's leading Jewish newspaper since 1960.

adam-minsky.name: Adam Minsky
adam-minsky.bio: President and CEO of UJA Federation of Greater Toronto, serving Canada's largest Jewish community (~200,000).

yair-szlak.name: Yair Szlak
yair-szlak.bio: President and CEO of Federation CJA, serving Montreal's Jewish community (~90,000).

joseph-mapa.name: Joseph Mapa
joseph-mapa.bio: Former CEO of Mount Sinai Hospital Toronto, founded in 1923 to serve the Jewish community.

alice-herscovitch.name: Alice Herscovitch
alice-herscovitch.bio: Former Executive Director of the Montreal Holocaust Museum, preserving survivor testimonies.

nina-krieger.name: Nina Krieger
nina-krieger.bio: Executive Director of the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre, founded by Holocaust survivors.

benjamin-basman.name: Benjamin Basman
benjamin-basman.bio: Rabbi and community leader associated with Toronto Hebrew Memorial Park, one of Canada's major Jewish cemeteries.

jeremy-leibler.name: Jeremy Leibler
jeremy-leibler.bio: President of the Zionist Federation of Australia (Jewish), leading advocate for Israel in the Australian Jewish community.
