jennifer-huppert.name: Jennifer Huppert
jennifer-huppert.bio: President of the Jewish Community Council of Victoria (Jewish), representing 60,000 Jews in Melbourne.

david-ossip.name: David Ossip
david-ossip.bio: President of the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, representing the Jewish community of New South Wales.

zeddy-lawrence.name: Zeddy Lawrence
zeddy-lawrence.bio: Editor of The Australian Jewish News, the community's primary newspaper since 1895.

helen-light.name: Helen Light
helen-light.bio: Former director of the Jewish Museum of Australia in Melbourne's St Kilda neighborhood.

norman-seligman.name: Norman Seligman
norman-seligman.bio: Co-founder of the Sydney Jewish Museum (Jewish), Holocaust survivor who helped establish the museum's survivor testimony program.

rabbi-john-levi.name: Rabbi John Levi
rabbi-john-levi.bio: Prominent Australian rabbi (Jewish) associated with Jewish education including Mount Scopus Memorial College in Melbourne.

john-hamey.name: John Hamey
john-hamey.bio: Principal of Moriah College, one of Australia's largest Jewish day schools in Sydney.

gideon-joffe.name: Gideon Joffe
gideon-joffe.bio: Chairman of the Jewish Community of Berlin (Jewish), the largest Jewish community in Germany.

affiliations.organization: Jüdische Gemeinde zu Berlin (Jewish Community of Berlin)

abraham-geiger.name: Abraham Geiger
abraham-geiger.bio: 19th-century German rabbi (Jewish) regarded as the founder of Reform Judaism. The college, founded in 1999, is named after him.

andreas-nachama.name: Andreas Nachama
andreas-nachama.bio: Chair of the Allgemeine Rabbinerkonferenz (Jewish), the General Rabbinical Conference of Germany.

philipp-peyman-engel.name: Philipp Peyman Engel
philipp-peyman-engel.bio: Editor-in-chief of the Jüdische Allgemeine (Jewish), Germany's main Jewish weekly newspaper.

aron-schuster.name: Aron Schuster
aron-schuster.bio: Director of the Zentralwohlfahrtsstelle (Jewish), the central welfare organization of Jews in Germany.

alon-meyer.name: Alon Meyer
alon-meyer.bio: President of Makkabi Deutschland (Jewish), organizing German Jewish athletes for the European Maccabi Games.

moses-mendelssohn.name: Moses Mendelssohn
moses-mendelssohn.bio: German-Jewish philosopher (1729-1786), the father of the Jewish Enlightenment (Haskalah). The center bears his name.

affiliations.organization: Moses Mendelssohn Center for European-Jewish Studies

leo-baeck.name: Leo Baeck
leo-baeck.bio: Rabbi Leo Baeck (1873-1956, Jewish), leader of German Jewry during the Nazi period, survived Theresienstadt. The institute preserves German-Jewish heritage.

g-nter-morsch.name: Günter Morsch
g-nter-morsch.bio: Former director of the Sachsenhausen Memorial, where over 200,000 people were imprisoned including many Jews.

eduard-knoblauch.name: Eduard Knoblauch
eduard-knoblauch.bio: Architect who designed the original Neue Synagoge (1866) in Moorish Revival style. It was damaged in Kristallnacht and WWII, later partially restored.

pinchas-goldschmidt.name: Pinchas Goldschmidt
pinchas-goldschmidt.bio: Former Chief Rabbi of Moscow (Jewish), served for over 30 years before leaving Russia in 2022 over the Ukraine invasion.

vladimir-potanin.name: Vladimir Potanin
vladimir-potanin.bio: Russian oligarch and president of Nornickel, the world's largest nickel and palladium producer. While not Jewish, has connections to Jewish business networks.

oleg-deripaska.name: Oleg Deripaska
oleg-deripaska.bio: Russian oligarch and founder of Rusal, the world's second-largest aluminum producer. His business dealings intersect with Jewish magnates.

adolf-shayevich.name: Adolf Shayevich
adolf-shayevich.bio: Chief Rabbi of Russia (Jewish), associated with the Moscow synagogues and Russian Jewish institutional life.

mark-grubarg.name: Mark Grubarg
mark-grubarg.bio: Chief Rabbi of St. Petersburg (Jewish), serving the Grand Choral Synagogue, built in 1893 in Moorish Revival style.

mikhail-chlenov.name: Mikhail Chlenov
mikhail-chlenov.bio: Russian-Jewish ethnographer and Secretary General of the Euro-Asian Jewish Congress.

jorge-knoblovits.name: Jorge Knoblovits
jorge-knoblovits.bio: President of DAIA (Jewish), Argentina's main Jewish political representation and anti-defamation organization.

alejandro-metzger.name: Alejandro Metzger
alejandro-metzger.bio: President of Sociedad Hebraica Argentina, Buenos Aires' largest Jewish community and sports club.

robert-cox.name: Robert Cox
robert-cox.bio: Legendary editor of the Buenos Aires Herald who exposed human rights abuses during Argentina's Dirty War.

affiliations.organization: Buenos Aires Herald / Jewish community media

ruth-kalenberg.name: Ruth Kalenberg
ruth-kalenberg.bio: Director of the Buenos Aires Jewish Museum, preserving the history of Argentina's 200,000-strong Jewish community.

adri-n-werthein.name: Adrián Werthein
adri-n-werthein.bio: Head of Grupo Werthein (Jewish), one of Argentina's most prominent business families with interests in telecom, banking, and agriculture.

graciela-jinich.name: Graciela Jinich
graciela-jinich.bio: Director of the Buenos Aires Holocaust Museum (Jewish), the first Holocaust museum in Latin America.

eduardo-barbero.name: Eduardo Barbero
eduardo-barbero.bio: Director of ORT Argentina (Jewish), operating one of the largest Jewish school networks in Latin America.

daniel-goldman.name: Daniel Goldman
daniel-goldman.bio: Rabbi of Beit El Congregation (Jewish), one of Buenos Aires' most prominent Conservative synagogues.

marcelo-polakoff.name: Marcelo Polakoff
marcelo-polakoff.bio: Rabbi of Templo Libertad (Jewish), Buenos Aires' oldest Ashkenazi synagogue, built in 1897.

claudio-lottenberg.name: Claudio Lottenberg
claudio-lottenberg.bio: President of CONIB (Jewish), the umbrella organization representing Brazil's 120,000 Jews.

fernando-lottenberg.name: Fernando Lottenberg
fernando-lottenberg.bio: Former president of FISESP (Jewish), who later served as Brazil's Special Envoy for Combating Antisemitism.

affiliations.organization: Federação Israelita do Estado de São Paulo (FISESP)

carlos-matayoshi.name: Carlos Matayoshi
carlos-matayoshi.bio: President of Clube Hebraica São Paulo, one of the largest Jewish community clubs in Latin America.

felipe-arruda.name: Felipe Arruda
felipe-arruda.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of São Paulo, opened in 2021 to document Jewish life in Brazil.

ruben-sternschein.name: Ruben Sternschein
ruben-sternschein.bio: Rabbi of Congregação Israelita Paulista (Jewish), one of the largest Reform congregations in Latin America.

daniela-riqueza.name: Daniela Riqueza
daniela-riqueza.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Rio de Janeiro, showcasing Jewish heritage in Brazil since 1977.

affiliations.organization: Museu Judaico do Rio de Janeiro

rowan-sobelvitch.name: Rowan Sobelvitch
rowan-sobelvitch.bio: National chairman of the South African Zionist Federation (Jewish), the oldest Zionist organization outside Europe.

peta-krost-maunder.name: Peta Krost Maunder
peta-krost-maunder.bio: Editor of the South African Jewish Report (Jewish), the community's main newspaper.

richard-memory.name: Richard Memory
richard-memory.bio: Director of the Cape Town Holocaust & Genocide Centre, combining Holocaust education with genocide awareness.

ariellah-rosenberg.name: Ariellah Rosenberg
ariellah-rosenberg.bio: National Director of ORT South Africa (Jewish), providing education and training programs.

koos-bekker.name: Koos Bekker
koos-bekker.bio: Former CEO and chairman of Naspers, who transformed it from a South African newspaper group into a global tech investor (Tencent, etc.). Not Jewish, but the company was founded by Afrikaner interests.

tali-nates.name: Tali Nates
tali-nates.bio: Founder and director of the Johannesburg Holocaust & Genocide Centre (Jewish, child of Holocaust survivors).

rabbi-harris.name: Rabbi Harris
rabbi-harris.bio: Principal associated with King David Schools (Jewish), the largest Jewish day school network in South Africa.

marc-sobel.name: Marc Sobel
marc-sobel.bio: Former principal of Herzlia School (Jewish), Cape Town's leading Jewish day school.

ben-memory.name: Ben Memory
ben-memory.bio: Chairman of South African Friends of Israel, advocating for Israel within South Africa.

solomon-sopher.name: Solomon Sopher
solomon-sopher.bio: Leader of the Bene Israel community (Jewish) and figure in the Central Jewish Board of India.

isaac-elia-jhirad.name: Isaac Elia Jhirad
isaac-elia-jhirad.bio: Prominent Bene Israel leader (Jewish) who served as surgeon-general in the Indian Army and advocated for the community.

jacob-sassoon.name: Jacob Sassoon
jacob-sassoon.bio: Built Knesset Eliyahoo Synagogue (1884) in Mumbai. Part of the Baghdadi Jewish Sassoon family who built an empire in India.

elijah-judah.name: Elijah Judah
elijah-judah.bio: Community figure associated with preserving the heritage of the Bene Israel, India's largest Jewish group with a 2,000+ year history.

marcos-shabot.name: Marcos Shabot
marcos-shabot.bio: President of the Comité Central de la Comunidad Judía de México (Jewish), representing Mexico's 50,000 Jews.

affiliations.organization: Comité Central de la Comunidad Judía de México

laura-goldsmith.name: Laura Goldsmith
laura-goldsmith.bio: Director of Tribuna Israelita (Jewish), combating antisemitism and promoting dialogue in Mexico.

emilio-azc-rraga-jean.name: Emilio Azcárraga Jean
emilio-azc-rraga-jean.bio: Former chairman of Grupo Televisa, the largest media company in the Spanish-speaking world. Has business connections with Jewish entrepreneurs.

mois-s-saad.name: Moisés Saad
mois-s-saad.bio: Director of Colegio Hebreo Maguen David (Jewish), one of Mexico City's largest Jewish schools, serving the Syrian community.

sharon-zaga.name: Sharon Zaga
sharon-zaga.bio: President and founder of the Museo Memoria y Tolerancia (Jewish), Mexico City's Holocaust and tolerance museum.

andr-s-heisler.name: András Heisler
andr-s-heisler.bio: President of Mazsihisz (Jewish), representing Hungary's approximately 100,000 Jews, the largest community in Central Europe.

lajos-kossuth.name: Lajos Kossuth
lajos-kossuth.bio: Designed by architect Ludwig Förster in 1854-59, with support from the Kossuth-era Hungarian liberal movement. Largest synagogue in Europe.

zsuzsanna-toronyi.name: Zsuzsanna Toronyi
zsuzsanna-toronyi.bio: Director of the Hungarian Jewish Museum and Archives (Jewish), located within the Dohány Street Synagogue complex.

can-togay.name: Can Togay
can-togay.bio: Film director who conceived the Shoes on the Danube Bank memorial (2005) with sculptor Gyula Pauer, honoring 3,500 Jews shot into the Danube.

andr-s-kov-cs.name: András Kovács
andr-s-kov-cs.bio: Sociologist and scholar (Jewish) leading efforts to preserve Hungary's vast Jewish architectural and cultural heritage.

anna-szeszler.name: Anna Szeszler
anna-szeszler.bio: Director of ORT Hungary, providing education and training in the tradition of the global ORT network.

barbara-staudinger.name: Barbara Staudinger
barbara-staudinger.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum Vienna (2022-), showcasing 1,000 years of Jewish life in Austria.

barbara-gl-ck.name: Barbara Glück
barbara-gl-ck.bio: Director of the Mauthausen Memorial, where approximately 90,000 people were murdered, including many Jews.

joseph-kornh-usel.name: Joseph Kornhäusel
joseph-kornh-usel.bio: Architect who designed the Stadttempel (1826), Vienna's only synagogue to survive Kristallnacht because it was hidden within a residential block.

binyomin-jacobs.name: Binyomin Jacobs
binyomin-jacobs.bio: Chief Rabbi of the Netherlands (Jewish), spiritual leader of the Dutch Ashkenazi Jewish community.

elias-bouman.name: Elias Bouman
elias-bouman.bio: Architect who designed the Portuguese Synagogue of Amsterdam (1675), built by Sephardic Jews who fled the Inquisition.

emile-schrijver.name: Emile Schrijver
emile-schrijver.bio: General Director of the Jewish Cultural Quarter Amsterdam (Jewish), including the Jewish Historical Museum.

etty-hillesum.name: Etty Hillesum
etty-hillesum.bio: Dutch Jewish writer whose letters and diaries from Westerbork, before her murder at Auschwitz, became celebrated Holocaust literature.

yohan-benizri.name: Yohan Benizri
yohan-benizri.bio: Swiss Jewish community leader and former president of the Swiss Federation of Jewish Communities (SIG/FSCI). Has advocated for Jewish rights and combated antisemitism in Switzerland, representing the interests of Swiss Jewry.

affiliations.organization: Coordinating Committee of Jewish Organisations in Belgium (CCOJB)

pascale-falek.name: Pascale Falek
pascale-falek.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Belgium, which was targeted in a deadly terror attack in 2014.

christoph-busch.name: Christoph Busch
christoph-busch.bio: Director of Kazerne Dossin, the memorial at the former transit camp from which 25,000 Jews were deported to Auschwitz.

pinchas-kornfeld.name: Pinchas Kornfeld
pinchas-kornfeld.bio: Chief Rabbi and leader of one of Europe's most Orthodox Jewish communities, centered in Antwerp's diamond district.

ralph-lewin.name: Ralph Lewin
ralph-lewin.bio: President of the Swiss Federation of Jewish Communities (Jewish), representing 18,000 Jews in Switzerland.

tedros-adhanom-ghebreyesus.name: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus
tedros-adhanom-ghebreyesus.bio: Director-General of WHO. Israel has advanced medical collaborations with WHO through its health tech innovations.

daniel-mariaschin.name: Daniel Mariaschin
daniel-mariaschin.bio: CEO of B'nai B'rith International (Jewish), the oldest Jewish service organization (1843), with its UN office in Geneva.

jean-fran-ois-bergier.name: Jean-François Bergier
jean-fran-ois-bergier.bio: Swiss historian who chaired the Independent Commission of Experts (1996-2002) investigating Switzerland's WWII-era dealings with Nazi Germany and dormant Jewish accounts.

peter-maurer.name: Peter Maurer
peter-maurer.bio: Former president of the ICRC. The ICRC's controversial WWII role - failing to intervene for Jews - led to formal apologies and study.

affiliations.organization: International Committee of the Red Cross (Jewish relationship)

noemi-di-segni.name: Noemi Di Segni
noemi-di-segni.bio: President of the Union of Italian Jewish Communities (UCEI) (Jewish), representing approximately 25,000 Italian Jews.

alessandra-di-castro.name: Alessandra Di Castro
alessandra-di-castro.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Rome, documenting Europe's oldest continuous Jewish community (since 161 BCE).

riccardo-di-segni.name: Riccardo Di Segni
riccardo-di-segni.bio: Chief Rabbi of Rome (Jewish), spiritual leader at the Great Synagogue (Tempio Maggiore), built in 1904.

shaul-bassi.name: Shaul Bassi
shaul-bassi.bio: Scholar and director of the Venice Center for Humanities and Social Change (Jewish), who has studied the Venice Ghetto - the world's first Jewish ghetto (1516).

joseph-levi.name: Joseph Levi
joseph-levi.bio: Rabbi of the Jewish community of Florence (Jewish), overseeing the Moorish Revival-style Tempio Maggiore (1882).

vincenza-maugeri.name: Vincenza Maugeri
vincenza-maugeri.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Bologna, documenting Jewish life in the Emilia-Romagna region since medieval times.

marco-impagliazzo.name: Marco Impagliazzo
marco-impagliazzo.bio: President of the Community of Sant'Egidio, which has led Catholic-Jewish interfaith dialogue since 1986.

isaac-querub.name: Isaac Querub
isaac-querub.bio: President of the Federation of Jewish Communities of Spain (Jewish), representing approximately 40,000-50,000 Jews.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities of Spain (additional)
Federation of Jewish Communities of Spain

samuel-ha-levi-abulafia.name: Samuel ha-Levi Abulafia
samuel-ha-levi-abulafia.bio: 14th-century treasurer to King Peter I of Castile (Jewish) who built the Synagogue of El Tránsito (1357), now the Sephardic Museum.

moses-maimonides.name: Moses Maimonides
moses-maimonides.bio: Born in Córdoba in 1138, Maimonides was the greatest medieval Jewish philosopher. A statue stands near the synagogue in the old Jewish quarter.

esther-bendahan.name: Esther Bendahan
esther-bendahan.bio: Director general of Casa Sefarad-Israel (Jewish), promoting Sephardic culture and Spain-Israel relations.

jakub-nowakowski.name: Jakub Nowakowski
jakub-nowakowski.bio: Director of the Galicia Jewish Museum in Kraków (Jewish), showcasing the rich Jewish heritage of Galicia.

zygmunt-st-pi-ski.name: Zygmunt Stępiński
zygmunt-st-pi-ski.bio: Director of POLIN Museum, the award-winning museum documenting 1,000 years of Polish Jewish history.

affiliations.organization: Museum of the History of Polish Jews (POLIN) - additional programs

tomasz-kranz.name: Tomasz Kranz
tomasz-kranz.bio: Director of the Majdanek State Museum, where approximately 78,000 people were murdered including 59,000 Jews.

edward-kop-wka.name: Edward Kopówka
edward-kop-wka.bio: Director of the Museum of Struggle and Martyrdom in Treblinka, where approximately 800,000 Jews were murdered.

mordechai-anielewicz.name: Mordechai Anielewicz
mordechai-anielewicz.bio: Commander of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising (April 1943, Jewish), the largest Jewish revolt against the Nazis. Killed at age 24.

izaak-malmed.name: Izaak Malmed
izaak-malmed.bio: Rabbi associated with the historic Tykocin Synagogue (1642), one of the best-preserved Baroque synagogues in Poland.

leo-pavl-t.name: Leo Pavlát
leo-pavl-t.bio: Former director of the Jewish Museum in Prague (Jewish), one of the oldest and most visited Jewish museums in the world.

rabbi-judah-loew-ben-bezalel.name: Rabbi Judah Loew ben Bezalel
rabbi-judah-loew-ben-bezalel.bio: The Maharal of Prague (c. 1520-1609, Jewish), legendary rabbi buried in the Old Jewish Cemetery, associated with the Golem legend.

ji-fiedler.name: Jiří Fiedler
ji-fiedler.bio: Czech researcher and documenter of Jewish heritage sites, whose work helped catalog the 77,297 names inscribed on the synagogue walls.

jan-munk.name: Jan Munk
jan-munk.bio: Director of the Terezín Memorial, commemorating the ghetto/transit camp where 33,000 Jews died and 88,000 were deported to death camps.

boris-lozhkin.name: Boris Lozhkin
boris-lozhkin.bio: President of the Jewish Confederation of Ukraine (Jewish), businessman and former head of the Presidential Administration of Ukraine.

natan-sharansky.name: Natan Sharansky
natan-sharansky.bio: Ukrainian-born Israeli politician. Born 1948 in Stalino (now Donetsk), Soviet Union. Soviet dissident and political prisoner (1978-1986). Became symbol of struggle for Soviet Jewry. Later Israeli politician and chairman of the Jewish Agency (2009-2018). Author of "The Case for Democracy."

meylakh-sheykhet.name: Meylakh Sheykhet
meylakh-sheykhet.bio: Representative of the Union of Jewish Religious Organizations of Ukraine, active in heritage preservation.

isaac-ben-nachman.name: Isaac ben Nachman
isaac-ben-nachman.bio: Builder of the original Golden Rose Synagogue (1582) in Lviv, one of the earliest stone synagogues in Eastern Europe. Destroyed by Nazis in 1943.

naim-g-lery-z.name: Naim Güleryüz
naim-g-lery-z.bio: Historian and author (Jewish, Turkish) who documented the 500-year history of Turkish Jewry since the 1492 Spanish expulsion.

i-shak-haleva.name: İshak Haleva
i-shak-haleva.bio: Hakham Bashi (Chief Rabbi) of Turkey (Jewish), spiritual leader of the Turkish Jewish community.

bayezid-ii.name: Bayezid II
bayezid-ii.bio: Ottoman Sultan who welcomed Sephardic Jews expelled from Spain in 1492, famously saying Ferdinand of Spain made his own country poor.

zhor-rehihil.name: Zhor Rehihil
zhor-rehihil.bio: Curator of the Museum of Moroccan Judaism (Muslim), the only Jewish museum in the Arab world, demonstrating Moroccan interfaith respect.

serge-berdugo.name: Serge Berdugo
serge-berdugo.bio: Secretary-General of the Council of Jewish Communities of Morocco (Jewish), ambassador-at-large.

affiliations.organization: Conseil des Communautes Israelites du Maroc
Conseil des Communautés Israélites du Maroc

rabbi-haim-pinto.name: Rabbi Haim Pinto
rabbi-haim-pinto.bio: 18th-century Moroccan rabbi (Jewish) revered as a miracle worker; his yahrzeit draws thousands of pilgrims to Essaouira.

aron-verst-ndig.name: Aron Verständig
aron-verst-ndig.bio: Chairman of the Official Council of Swedish Jewish Communities (Jewish), representing approximately 15,000 Swedish Jews.

affiliations.organization: Official Council of Swedish Jewish Communities

petra-kahn-nord.name: Petra Kahn Nord
petra-kahn-nord.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum in Stockholm, documenting Jewish life in Sweden since the 18th century.

ute-steyer.name: Ute Steyer
ute-steyer.bio: Rabbi of the Great Synagogue of Stockholm (Jewish), serving Sweden's largest Jewish community.

dan-rosenberg-asmussen.name: Dan Rosenberg Asmussen
dan-rosenberg-asmussen.bio: Chairman of the Jewish Community of Denmark (Jewish), representing approximately 6,000 Danish Jews.

yair-melchior.name: Yair Melchior
yair-melchior.bio: Chief Rabbi of Denmark (Jewish), spiritual leader of the Danish Jewish community.

georg-ferdinand-duckwitz.name: Georg Ferdinand Duckwitz
georg-ferdinand-duckwitz.bio: German diplomat who warned Danish Jews of the planned Nazi roundup in October 1943, enabling the rescue of 7,200 Jews by boat to Sweden.

ervin-kohn.name: Ervin Kohn
ervin-kohn.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Oslo (Jewish), representing Norway's approximately 1,500 Jews.

guri-hjeltnes.name: Guri Hjeltnes
guri-hjeltnes.bio: Director associated with documenting Norway's Jewish history, including the deportation of Norwegian Jews during WWII.

affiliations.organization: Center for Studies of the Holocaust and Religious Minorities (HL-senteret)

yaron-nadbornik.name: Yaron Nadbornik
yaron-nadbornik.bio: Chairman of the Central Council of Jewish Communities in Finland (Jewish), representing approximately 1,300 Finnish Jews.

affiliations.organization: Central Council of Jewish Communities in Finland

david-saltiel.name: David Saltiel
david-saltiel.bio: President of the Central Board of Jewish Communities in Greece (Jewish), representing approximately 5,000 Greek Jews.

affiliations.organization: Central Board of Jewish Communities in Greece
Central Board of Jewish Communities in Greece (KIS)

zanet-battinou.name: Zanet Battinou
zanet-battinou.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Greece in Athens, documenting 2,300 years of Greek Jewish (Romaniote) history.

erika-perahia-zemour.name: Erika Perahia-Zemour
erika-perahia-zemour.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Thessaloniki (Jewish), documenting the city once known as 'Mother of Israel' for its vast Jewish population.

yitzchak-kerem.name: Yitzchak Kerem
yitzchak-kerem.bio: Scholar of Greek Jewish history. The memorial honors 50,000 Thessaloniki Jews deported to Auschwitz in 1943 - 96% of the community.

marcia-haddad-ikonomopoulos.name: Marcia Haddad Ikonomopoulos
marcia-haddad-ikonomopoulos.bio: Founder of Kehila Kedosha Janina (Jewish), the only Romaniote synagogue in the Western Hemisphere, in New York.

jos-oulman-carp.name: José Oulman Carp
jos-oulman-carp.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Lisbon (Jewish), representing Portugal's approximately 3,000 Jews.

captain-barros-basto.name: Captain Barros Basto
captain-barros-basto.bio: Portuguese army officer (Jewish) who led the 'Rescue' movement to reconnect crypto-Jews (Bnei Anusim) with Judaism in the 1920s-30s.

samuel-schwarz.name: Samuel Schwarz
samuel-schwarz.bio: Jewish-Polish mining engineer who in 1917 discovered the crypto-Jewish community of Belmonte, which had secretly practiced Judaism for 500 years.

homayoun-sameyah-najafabadi.name: Homayoun Sameyah Najafabadi
homayoun-sameyah-najafabadi.bio: Jewish member of the Iranian Majlis (parliament), holding the constitutionally guaranteed seat for the Jewish community.

avraham-neguise.name: Avraham Neguise
avraham-neguise.bio: Ethiopian-born Israeli politician (Jewish), first Ethiopian-born member of the Knesset, advocate for Ethiopian Jewish rights.

qes-hadane.name: Qes Hadane
qes-hadane.bio: One of the last kessim (Bete Israel religious leaders) who served the North Shewa community before emigration.

uri-lubrani.name: Uri Lubrani
uri-lubrani.bio: Israeli diplomat (Jewish) who coordinated Operation Solomon, the dramatic 36-hour airlift of 14,325 Ethiopian Jews in 1991.

binyamin-edery.name: Binyamin Edery
binyamin-edery.bio: Moroccan-born Jewish community leader and senior rabbi who has served the Jewish community in Morocco, maintaining the traditions of one of the most historically significant Sephardic communities in the world.

anatole-ponevejsky.name: Anatole Ponevejsky
anatole-ponevejsky.bio: Leader of the Kobe Jewish community (Jewcom) during WWII who helped coordinate aid for Jewish refugees transiting through Japan.

chen-jian.name: Chen Jian
chen-jian.bio: Former curator of the Shanghai Jewish Refugees Museum, documenting the stories of 20,000 Jewish refugees.

shi-lei.name: Shi Lei
shi-lei.bio: One of the Kaifeng Jewish descendants who reconnected with Judaism and made aliyah to Israel.

sir-victor-sassoon.name: Sir Victor Sassoon
sir-victor-sassoon.bio: Jewish businessman of Baghdadi origin, built the Cathay Hotel (now Fairmont Peace Hotel) and was one of the wealthiest men in Asia.

sir-jacob-elias-sassoon.name: Sir Jacob Elias Sassoon
sir-jacob-elias-sassoon.bio: Jewish businessman of Baghdadi origin who built the Ohel Rachel Synagogue (1920), the largest synagogue in East Asia.

gustavo-kraselnik.name: Gustavo Kraselnik
gustavo-kraselnik.bio: Former president of the Panama Jewish community, editor of Shalom Panama magazine.

ricardo-lackner.name: Ricardo Lackner
ricardo-lackner.bio: Panamanian Jewish community leader who has served as president of the Kol Shearith Israel congregation, the leading Jewish institution in Panama. Active in strengthening Jewish communal life in Central America.

gerardo-gorodischer.name: Gerardo Gorodischer
gerardo-gorodischer.bio: President of the Comunidad Judía de Chile (Jewish), representing 18,000 Chilean Jews.

marco-peckel.name: Marco Peckel
marco-peckel.bio: Former president of the Confederación de Comunidades Judías de Colombia (Jewish).

affiliations.organization: Confederación de Comunidades Judías de Colombia

juliet-moses.name: Juliet Moses
juliet-moses.bio: Spokesperson for the New Zealand Jewish Council (Jewish), prominent advocate against antisemitism.

silviu-vexler.name: Silviu Vexler
silviu-vexler.bio: Jewish member of the Romanian Parliament, holding the dedicated minority seat, active in Holocaust remembrance.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in Romania
Federation of Jewish Communities in Romania

dennis-leventhal.name: Dennis Leventhal
dennis-leventhal.bio: Founder and president of the Jewish Historical Society of Hong Kong, documenting 175 years of Jewish life.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Historical Society of Hong Kong

michael-kadoorie.name: Michael Kadoorie
michael-kadoorie.bio: Sir Michael Kadoorie (Jewish, Baghdadi origin), billionaire businessman and patron of the Ohel Leah Synagogue in Hong Kong.

adela-dworin.name: Adela Dworin
adela-dworin.bio: Longtime president of Havana's Jewish community (Jewish), keeping the community alive through decades of the Castro era.

affiliations.organization: Patronato de la Casa de la Comunidad Hebrea de Cuba

alexander-wandersman.name: Alexander Wandersman
alexander-wandersman.bio: Community leader of the Nairobi Hebrew Congregation, serving East Africa's small Jewish community.

ahmed-el-tayeb.name: Ahmed el-Tayeb
ahmed-el-tayeb.bio: Grand Imam of Al-Azhar who co-signed the Document on Human Fraternity, inspiring the Abrahamic Family House.

elli-kriel.name: Elli Kriel
elli-kriel.bio: South African-born chef (Jewish) who pioneered Dubai's kosher dining scene, creating 'Elli's Kosher Kitchen.'

affiliations.organization: Kosher restaurants and community in Dubai

maurice-cohen.name: Maurice Cohen
maurice-cohen.bio: Former president of the Jewish Representative Council of Ireland, representing approximately 2,500 Irish Jews.

chaim-herzog.name: Chaim Herzog
chaim-herzog.bio: 6th President of Israel (1983-1993, Jewish), born in Belfast and raised in Dublin; his father was Chief Rabbi of Ireland.

ognjen-kraus.name: Ognjen Kraus
ognjen-kraus.bio: President of the Jewish community of Zagreb and the Coordination of Jewish Communities in Croatia (Jewish).

robert-sabado.name: Robert Sabadoš
robert-sabado.bio: Filipino Jewish community leader who has played a pivotal role in maintaining the small but vibrant Jewish community life in the Philippines, primarily centered in Manila at Temple Emil.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in Serbia

oscar-asenov.name: Oscar Asenov
oscar-asenov.bio: Bulgarian Jewish community leader who has served in leadership positions within the Shalom Organization of Jews in Bulgaria. Works to preserve the remarkable history of Bulgarian Jewry, including the rescue of 50,000 Jews during the Holocaust.

affiliations.organization: Organization of the Jews in Bulgaria

perez-trabelsi.name: Perez Trabelsi
perez-trabelsi.bio: Leader of the Jewish community of Djerba (Jewish), overseeing the annual El Ghriba pilgrimage.

milikh-yevdayev.name: Milikh Yevdayev
milikh-yevdayev.bio: Leader of the Mountain Jewish community in Azerbaijan, based at the Red Settlement (Qırmızı Qəsəbə).

ariel-levin.name: Ariel Levin
ariel-levin.bio: Chief Rabbi of Georgia (Jewish), serving the remaining Georgian Jewish community.

roshel-rubinov.name: Roshel Rubinov
roshel-rubinov.bio: Last chief rabbi of the Bukharan Jewish community in Uzbekistan before mass emigration.

jaime-braun.name: Jaime Braun
jaime-braun.bio: Former president of Asociación Judía del Perú (Jewish), leading Lima's approximately 2,500 Jews.

david-bittan.name: David Bittan
david-bittan.bio: Former president of CAIV (Jewish), leading the Venezuelan Jewish community during challenging political times.

affiliations.organization: Confederación de Asociaciones Israelitas de Venezuela (CAIV)
CAIV - Confederación de Asociaciones Israelitas de Venezuela

jaime-gutman.name: Jaime Gutman
jaime-gutman.bio: Leader of the Centro Israelita Sionista de Costa Rica (Jewish), representing 2,500 Costa Rican Jews.

affiliations.organization: Centro Israelita Sionista de Costa Rica

yaffa-grazioso.name: Yaffa Grazioso
yaffa-grazioso.bio: Guatemalan Jewish community leader and advocate for the Guatemalan Jewish community, which numbers approximately 1,200 people. Active in regional Jewish communal affairs and cultural preservation.

samuel-benchoam.name: Samuel Benchoam
samuel-benchoam.bio: Guatemalan-Jewish businessman and community leader who has played a significant role in Guatemala's Jewish community. His family is prominent in Guatemalan business circles, and he has supported Jewish institutional life in Central America.

ricardo-udler.name: Ricardo Udler
ricardo-udler.bio: President of the Círculo Israelita de Bolivia (Jewish), leading La Paz's small Jewish community.

luis-hess.name: Luis Hess
luis-hess.bio: One of the original Jewish refugees who settled in Sosúa in the 1940s and built the dairy cooperative.

ainsley-henriques.name: Ainsley Henriques
ainsley-henriques.bio: Historian and leader of Jamaica's Jewish community (Jewish), expert on Caribbean Sephardic history.

yosef-kantor.name: Yosef Kantor
yosef-kantor.bio: Chabad rabbi serving Thailand (Jewish), operating one of the world's largest Chabad networks outside Israel.

ilan-fluss.name: Ilan Fluss
ilan-fluss.bio: Community leader of the Jewish Association of the Philippines, serving Manila's small Jewish community.

osher-litzman.name: Osher Litzman
osher-litzman.bio: Israeli rabbi and community leader who has served in Jewish communities across the diaspora, helping establish and strengthen Jewish life in smaller communities. Part of Chabad's global outreach network.

menachem-hartman.name: Menachem Hartman
menachem-hartman.bio: Chabad rabbi serving Vietnam (Jewish), providing Jewish services in Ho Chi Minh City.

shlomi-tabib.name: Shlomi Tabib
shlomi-tabib.bio: Israeli businessman and entrepreneur who has been active in real estate and business development. Connected to Israeli business networks in Africa and the developing world. Part of Israel's expanding global economic footprint.

howard-gorin.name: Howard Gorin
howard-gorin.bio: Rabbi who has visited and supported the Igbo Jewish community in Nigeria, helping with education and formal conversion.

moira-chipkin.name: Moira Chipkin
moira-chipkin.bio: Community leader in the Zimbabwe Jewish community, managing affairs as the community has dwindled.

simone-awerbach.name: Simone Awerbach
simone-awerbach.bio: One of the last remaining members of the Lubumbashi Jewish community in the DRC.

zvi-gorelick.name: Zvi Gorelick
zvi-gorelick.bio: Israeli rabbi and Chabad emissary who has served Jewish communities in various countries. Part of the worldwide network of Chabad-Lubavitch emissaries working to strengthen Jewish identity and provide religious services globally.

magda-haroun.name: Magda Haroun
magda-haroun.bio: President of the Egyptian Jewish Community (Jewish), managing affairs for the fewer than 10 remaining Jews in Egypt.

jack-saul.name: Jack Saul
jack-saul.bio: Representative of the Syrian Jewish community in Brooklyn (Jewish), which has grown to over 60,000 and preserves Syrian traditions.

naim-dangoor.name: Naim Dangoor
naim-dangoor.bio: Sir Naim Dangoor (1914-2015, Jewish), Iraqi-born British businessman and philanthropist who preserved Iraqi Jewish heritage.

mordechai-ben-porat.name: Mordechai Ben-Porat
mordechai-ben-porat.bio: Israeli politician (Jewish, Iraqi-born) who was involved in organizing the mass immigration of Iraqi Jews to Israel.

rabbi-yihya-yitzhak-halevi.name: Rabbi Yihya Yitzhak Halevi
rabbi-yihya-yitzhak-halevi.bio: Former chief rabbi of Yemen (Jewish), one of the last religious leaders of the ancient Yemeni Jewish community.

raffaello-fellah.name: Raffaello Fellah
raffaello-fellah.bio: Chairman of the World Organization of Libyan Jews (Jewish), preserving the memory and heritage of Libyan Jewry.

moses-samuels.name: Moses Samuels
moses-samuels.bio: Self-appointed caretaker of the Musmeah Yeshua Synagogue (Jewish), one of the last Jews in Myanmar, dedicated decades to preserving the synagogue.

rabbi-haim-mendes-chumaceiro.name: Rabbi Haim Mendes Chumaceiro
rabbi-haim-mendes-chumaceiro.bio: 19th-century rabbi of Mikvé Israel-Emanuel (Jewish), leading the oldest continuous congregation in the Western Hemisphere.

samuel-nassy.name: Samuel Nassy
samuel-nassy.bio: Sephardic Jewish plantation owner who was among the founders of the Jodensavanne settlement in 17th-century Suriname.

ren-fernandes.name: René Fernandes
ren-fernandes.bio: Brazilian Jewish community leader who has served in community organizations supporting the Jewish population in Brazil, one of the largest Jewish communities in Latin America with approximately 120,000 members.

rabbi-ronnie-hassid.name: Rabbi Ronnie Hassid
rabbi-ronnie-hassid.bio: Chief Rabbi of Gibraltar (Jewish), leading one of the world's highest per-capita Jewish communities.

robert-singer.name: Robert Singer
robert-singer.bio: Serbian-born Jewish leader who served as CEO of the World Jewish Congress, embodying the Serbian Jewish diaspora.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities of Serbia

amir-peled.name: Amir Peled
amir-peled.bio: Chairman of Maccabi World Union (Jewish), overseeing the Maccabiah Games and global Maccabi sports network.

gideon-taylor.name: Gideon Taylor
gideon-taylor.bio: President of the Claims Conference (Jewish), overseeing distribution of over $80 billion in German reparations.

affiliations.organization: Conference on Jewish Material Claims Against Germany (Claims Conference)
Claims Conference (Conference on Jewish Material Claims Against Germany)

kerry-whigham.name: Kerry Whigham
kerry-whigham.bio: Scholar involved with IHRA, the 35-member intergovernmental body promoting Holocaust education. IHRA's antisemitism definition has been widely adopted.

phyllis-heideman.name: Phyllis Heideman
phyllis-heideman.bio: President of the International March of the Living (Jewish), leading the annual march from Auschwitz to Birkenau.

sam-grundwerg.name: Sam Grundwerg
sam-grundwerg.bio: World Chairman of Keren Hayesod (Jewish), the principal fundraising organization for Israel.

rabbi-doron-perez.name: Rabbi Doron Perez
rabbi-doron-perez.bio: Executive Chairman of World Mizrachi (Jewish), leading the Religious Zionist movement globally.

shmuel-rosenman.name: Shmuel Rosenman
shmuel-rosenman.bio: Founder and Chairman of the International March of the Living (Jewish), organizing the annual event since 1988.

rabbi-sholom-lipskar.name: Rabbi Sholom Lipskar
rabbi-sholom-lipskar.bio: Founder and president of the Aleph Institute (Jewish), established at the Lubavitcher Rebbe's direction to serve Jewish prisoners.

rabbi-noach-weinberg.name: Rabbi Noach Weinberg
rabbi-noach-weinberg.bio: Founder of Aish HaTorah (1930-2009, Jewish), one of the most influential Jewish outreach (kiruv) leaders in modern history.

rabbi-nota-schiller.name: Rabbi Nota Schiller
rabbi-nota-schiller.bio: Co-founder and Dean of Ohr Somayach (Jewish), pioneering the baal teshuva yeshiva concept.

remy-ilona.name: Remy Ilona
remy-ilona.bio: Nigerian-Jewish author and community leader who has written extensively on the Igbo-Jewish connection.

gershom-sizomu.name: Gershom Sizomu
gershom-sizomu.bio: First black African rabbi ordained at a rabbinical seminary. Serves as both spiritual leader and elected member of Uganda's parliament.

affiliations.organization: Abayudaya Jewish Community of Uganda (East Africa Office)

david-elias-tanzania.name: David Elias
david-elias-tanzania.bio: Coordinates Jewish community events and maintains connections with international Jewish organizations in East Africa.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Community of Dar es Salaam

ashrel-madagascar.name: Ashrel
ashrel-madagascar.bio: Spiritual leader of the Malagasy Jewish community working to establish formal Jewish institutions on the island.

rabbi-yosef-kantor.name: Rabbi Yosef Kantor
rabbi-yosef-kantor.bio: Chabad emissary who has served as the chief rabbi of Thailand since 1994, establishing Jewish infrastructure across the country.

rabbi-osher-litzman.name: Rabbi Osher Litzman
rabbi-osher-litzman.bio: Chabad rabbi serving the Jewish community in Seoul since 2008, providing kosher food, Shabbat services, and Jewish education.

frank-ephraim.name: Frank Ephraim
frank-ephraim.bio: Author and historian who documented the rescue of Jewish refugees in the Philippines during World War II.

rabbi-menachem-hartman.name: Rabbi Menachem Hartman
rabbi-menachem-hartman.bio: Chabad emissary to Vietnam providing Jewish services and community building in Ho Chi Minh City.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Community of Ho Chi Minh City

isaac-lee.name: Isaac Lee
isaac-lee.bio: Colombian-Jewish media executive who served as chief content officer at Univision, notable member of the Colombian Jewish community.

affiliations.organization: Confederación de Comunidades Judías de Colombia

eduardo-bigio.name: Eduardo Bigio
eduardo-bigio.bio: Longstanding leader in the Peruvian Jewish community involved in education and interfaith initiatives.

heinz-moeller.name: Heinz Moeller
heinz-moeller.bio: One of the founders of organized Jewish life in Ecuador, establishing key community institutions.

jaime-daremblum.name: Jaime Daremblum
jaime-daremblum.bio: Costa Rican-Jewish diplomat who served as ambassador to the United States, prominent figure in Costa Rican Jewish community.

affiliations.organization: Centro Israelita Sionista de Costa Rica

jorge-garcia-granados.name: Jorge García Granados
jorge-garcia-granados.bio: Guatemalan diplomat who served as ambassador to the UN and was instrumental in the 1947 partition vote supporting Israel's creation.

aurel-vainer.name: Aurel Vainer
aurel-vainer.bio: Former president of FCER who also served as Romania's parliamentary representative for the Jewish minority.

maxim-behar.name: Maxim Behar
maxim-behar.bio: Bulgarian-Jewish PR mogul and community supporter who promotes Bulgaria's Holocaust rescue history internationally.

affiliations.organization: Shalom Organization of Jews in Bulgaria

misha-galperin.name: Misha Galperin
misha-galperin.bio: CEO of the National Museum of American Jewish History, leading the institution's mission to present the American Jewish story.

affiliations.organization: National Museum of American Jewish History

mitchel-aeder.name: Mitchel Aeder
mitchel-aeder.bio: President of the Orthodox Union, overseeing the organization's religious, educational, and public policy programs.

deborah-waxman.name: Deborah Waxman
deborah-waxman.bio: First woman and first lesbian to lead a Jewish seminary and denominational movement, serving as president of Reconstructing Judaism.

avi-hasson.name: Avi Hasson
avi-hasson.bio: Former Chief Scientist of Israel's Ministry of Economy who leads Start-Up Nation Central, promoting Israeli innovation internationally.

esther-hayut.name: Esther Hayut
esther-hayut.bio: Served as Chief Justice of Israel until 2023, notably leading the court during the 2023 judicial reform crisis.

francis-nappez.name: Francis Nappez
francis-nappez.bio: French tech entrepreneur. Co-founder and CTO of BlaBlaCar, Europe's largest long-distance carpooling platform with over 100 million members in 22 countries. Built the technology platform that made trusted ridesharing possible at scale.

dominique-mandonnaud.name: Dominique Mandonnaud
dominique-mandonnaud.bio: French Jewish businessman and founder of Sephora, the pioneering beauty retailer. Created the revolutionary open-sell concept that allowed customers to try products before purchasing. Sephora was acquired by LVMH in 1997 and expanded to over 2,700 stores worldwide.

niklas-stberg.name: Niklas Östberg
niklas-stberg.bio: Swedish-German entrepreneur who co-founded Delivery Hero in 2011. Built the company into one of the world's largest food delivery platforms despite persistent financial losses.

luciano-benetton.name: Luciano Benetton
luciano-benetton.bio: Italian businessman and co-founder of Benetton Group, the global fashion brand known for its colorful knitwear and provocative advertising campaigns. Built the company from a small knitting workshop in Treviso into a worldwide fashion empire with thousands of stores.

leonardo-del-vecchio.name: Leonardo Del Vecchio
leonardo-del-vecchio.bio: Italian billionaire who built Luxottica from a small workshop into a global eyewear giant.

amancio-ortega.name: Amancio Ortega
amancio-ortega.bio: Spanish billionaire who founded Inditex and Zara, one of the wealthiest people in the world.

marc-rich.name: Marc Rich
marc-rich.bio: Belgian-born American-Israeli commodities trader who founded Glencore (originally Marc Rich + Co AG).

barbara-spectre.name: Barbara Spectre
barbara-spectre.bio: American-born Swedish Jewish academic and founder of Paideia, the European Institute for Jewish Studies in Sweden. Works to revitalize European Jewish intellectual life and foster multicultural dialogue. Has been a controversial figure in online discourse.

affiliations.organization: Paideia - The European Institute for Jewish Studies

daniel-ek.name: Daniel Ek
daniel-ek.bio: Swedish entrepreneur. Born 1983. Co-founded Spotify in 2006. CEO since inception. Mother is of Jewish heritage. Built Spotify into the world's largest music streaming platform with 600+ million users. Forbes estimated net worth exceeds $5 billion.

roberto-marinho.name: Roberto Marinho
roberto-marinho.bio: Brazilian media magnate (1904-2003) who built Rede Globo into Latin America's largest media conglomerate and one of the world's biggest television networks. Globo produces more content than any other broadcaster and reaches over 200 million viewers.

marcos-galperin.name: Marcos Galperin
marcos-galperin.bio: Argentine Jewish billionaire entrepreneur, founder and CEO of MercadoLibre, Latin America's most valuable company and largest e-commerce platform. Founded at Stanford in 1999, the company now operates in 18 countries with a market cap exceeding $80 billion.

carlos-slim.name: Carlos Slim
carlos-slim.bio: Mexican business magnate, one of the richest people in the world, of Lebanese Christian descent but with close Jewish community ties.

gavriel-holtzberg.name: Gavriel Holtzberg
gavriel-holtzberg.bio: Chabad rabbi who directed the Mumbai Chabad House until his murder in the 2008 terrorist attacks.

mukesh-ambani.name: Mukesh Ambani
mukesh-ambani.bio: Indian billionaire businessman, chairman of Reliance Industries, one of the richest people in the world.

ratan-tata.name: Ratan Tata
ratan-tata.bio: Indian industrialist (1937-2024) and former chairman of Tata Sons, the holding company of the Tata Group, India's largest conglomerate. Under his leadership, Tata acquired Jaguar Land Rover and Corus Steel. Known for his philanthropy and impeccable integrity.

n-r-narayana-murthy.name: N. R. Narayana Murthy
n-r-narayana-murthy.bio: Indian billionaire IT industrialist often called the 'Father of the Indian IT industry'.

masayoshi-son.name: Masayoshi Son
masayoshi-son.bio: Japanese-Korean billionaire who founded SoftBank. One of the world's most prolific tech investors.

akio-morita.name: Akio Morita
akio-morita.bio: Japanese businessman who co-founded Sony and was instrumental in making it a global brand.

akio-toyoda.name: Akio Toyoda
akio-toyoda.bio: Great-grandson of founder Sakichi Toyoda, led Toyota as president and now serves as chairman.

jacob-elias-sassoon.name: Jacob Elias Sassoon
jacob-elias-sassoon.bio: Baghdadi Jewish businessman who built the Ohel Rachel Synagogue in memory of his wife.

ma-huateng-pony-ma.name: Ma Huateng (Pony Ma)
ma-huateng-pony-ma.bio: Chinese billionaire businessman and co-founder of Tencent, one of the world's largest technology companies. Built Tencent from a messaging service (QQ/WeChat) into a global tech giant with a market cap exceeding $400 billion spanning gaming, social media, and fintech.

jack-ma.name: Jack Ma
jack-ma.bio: Chinese billionaire entrepreneur and co-founder of Alibaba Group, one of the world's largest e-commerce companies. Built Alibaba from his apartment in Hangzhou into a global technology empire. Largely disappeared from public life after criticizing Chinese regulators in 2020.

lee-jae-yong.name: Lee Jae-yong
lee-jae-yong.bio: South Korean billionaire businessman and executive chairman of Samsung Electronics, the world's largest semiconductor and electronics company. Grandson of Samsung founder Lee Byung-chul. Has faced multiple corruption convictions related to South Korean political scandals.

chung-eui-sun.name: Chung Eui-sun
chung-eui-sun.bio: Chairman of Hyundai Motor Group, overseeing the company's push into electric and autonomous vehicles.

mike-cannon-brookes.name: Mike Cannon-Brookes
mike-cannon-brookes.bio: Australian billionaire technology entrepreneur and co-founder and co-CEO of Atlassian, the enterprise software company behind Jira and Confluence. Also a major clean energy investor and advocate for climate action in Australia.

menachem-mendel-schneerson.name: Menachem Mendel Schneerson
menachem-mendel-schneerson.bio: Seventh Rebbe of Chabad-Lubavitch, one of the most influential Jewish leaders of the 20th century who built Chabad into a global movement.

robert-h-steers.name: Robert H. Steers
robert-h-steers.bio: American financier and co-founder of Cohen & Steers, the first investment company dedicated to real estate securities. Built the firm into a leading manager of real estate, preferred securities, and infrastructure investments with billions under management.

kevin-plank.name: Kevin Plank
kevin-plank.bio: American entrepreneur and founder of Under Armour, the sports apparel company. Built the brand from his grandmother's basement into a multi-billion dollar global sportswear company competing with Nike and Adidas. Recently returned as CEO in 2024.

tobias-l-tke.name: Tobias Lütke
tobias-l-tke.bio: German-Canadian entrepreneur who co-founded Shopify in 2006 after trying to build an online snowboard store. Built it into the world's leading e-commerce platform.

nikolay-storonsky.name: Nikolay Storonsky
nikolay-storonsky.bio: Russian-born British fintech entrepreneur and co-founder of Revolut, one of Europe's most valuable fintech companies with a valuation exceeding $33 billion. Born to a Jewish family of scientists. Built Revolut from a travel money card into a global digital bank.

demis-hassabis.name: Demis Hassabis
demis-hassabis.bio: British-Greek AI researcher and co-founder of DeepMind, which was acquired by Google for over $500 million. Led the team that created AlphaGo and AlphaFold, winning the Nobel Prize in Chemistry 2024 for protein structure prediction. One of the most influential AI scientists.

jamie-dimon.name: Jamie Dimon
jamie-dimon.bio: American billionaire businessman. Chairman and CEO of JPMorgan Chase since 2005. Leads the largest bank in the United States. JPMorgan maintained Jeffrey Epstein as a client for over 15 years despite his 2008 conviction. The bank settled with Epstein victims and the US Virgin Islands for a combined $365 million in 2023, admitting to compliance failures in monitoring Epstein's accounts. Named the most influential banker in the world.

jensen-huang.name: Jensen Huang
jensen-huang.bio: Taiwanese-American billionaire businessman and co-founder and CEO of NVIDIA, which he has led since 1993. Under his leadership, NVIDIA became the world's most valuable company, with its GPUs powering the AI revolution and data centers worldwide.

stewart-butterfield.name: Stewart Butterfield
stewart-butterfield.bio: Canadian-American entrepreneur. Born 1973, Jewish heritage. Co-founded Flickr (sold to Yahoo) and Slack Technologies. Slack was acquired by Salesforce for $27.7 billion in 2021. Changed workplace communication globally.

joe-tsai.name: Joe Tsai
joe-tsai.bio: Taiwanese-Canadian billionaire, co-founder of Alibaba, owner of the Brooklyn Nets.

gary-hirshberg.name: Gary Hirshberg
gary-hirshberg.bio: American businessman dubbed the 'CE-Yo' who grew Stonyfield into a major organic brand.

vilna-gaon.name: Vilna Gaon
vilna-gaon.bio: Rabbi Elijah ben Solomon Zalman, one of the most influential Jewish scholars of modern times.

hannah-greenbaum-solomon.name: Hannah Greenbaum Solomon
hannah-greenbaum-solomon.bio: Social activist who founded the National Council of Jewish Women at the 1893 World's Fair.

hock-tan.name: Hock Tan
hock-tan.bio: Malaysian-American billionaire businessman and CEO of Broadcom Inc. Born in Penang to a Jewish family. Led Broadcom's $61 billion acquisition of VMware and built the company into one of the world's largest semiconductor firms.

daniel-edelman.name: Daniel Edelman
daniel-edelman.bio: American public relations pioneer who founded what became the world's largest PR firm.

vincent-bollor.name: Vincent Bolloré
vincent-bollor.bio: French billionaire industrialist who controls Groupe Bolloré and Vivendi. Convicted of corruption for bribing African officials for port contracts. Accused of using his media empire (CNews, Canal+) to promote far-right politics in France.

bernard-arnault.name: Bernard Arnault
bernard-arnault.bio: French billionaire businessman. Chairman and CEO of LVMH, the world's largest luxury goods company. Has been the richest person in the world. Controls brands including Louis Vuitton, Dior, Tiffany, Hennessy, and more.

fran-ois-henri-pinault.name: François-Henri Pinault
fran-ois-henri-pinault.bio: French billionaire businessman and CEO of Kering, the luxury goods conglomerate owning Gucci, Saint Laurent, Balenciaga, and Alexander McQueen. Son of Francois Pinault, founder of Kering. Married to actress Salma Hayek.

zalman-bernstein.name: Zalman Bernstein
zalman-bernstein.bio: American Jewish investor and philanthropist (1926-1999) who founded Sanford C. Bernstein & Co. and became a major benefactor of Jewish education and institutions. Established the AVI CHAI Foundation and was a pioneer in promoting Jewish day school education.

samuel-irving-newhouse-sr.name: Samuel Irving Newhouse Sr.
samuel-irving-newhouse-sr.bio: American media entrepreneur who built a publishing empire. Son of Jewish immigrants from Russia and Austria.

abraham-ikuro-teshima.name: Abraham Ikuro Teshima
abraham-ikuro-teshima.bio: Japanese Christian leader who founded the Makuya movement and fostered deep ties with Israel.

emanuel-ringelblum.name: Emanuel Ringelblum
emanuel-ringelblum.bio: Polish-Jewish historian who organized the secret Oyneg Shabes archive in the Warsaw Ghetto.

moses-sofer.name: Moses Sofer
moses-sofer.bio: Leading Orthodox rabbi known as the Chatam Sofer, head of the Pressburg Yeshiva, one of the most influential rabbis of the modern era.

steve-wynn.name: Steve Wynn
steve-wynn.bio: American real estate businessman and art collector who revitalized the Las Vegas Strip.

franz-kafka.name: Franz Kafka
franz-kafka.bio: German-speaking Bohemian novelist (1883-1924). One of the major figures of 20th-century literature. Born into a middle-class Ashkenazi Jewish family in Prague.

hannah-arendt.name: Hannah Arendt
hannah-arendt.bio: German-American political theorist (1906-1975). Wrote 'The Origins of Totalitarianism' and coined 'the banality of evil' while covering the Eichmann trial.

emma-lazarus.name: Emma Lazarus
emma-lazarus.bio: American poet (1849-1887). Wrote 'The New Colossus' sonnet ('Give me your tired, your poor') on the Statue of Liberty. Of Sephardic Jewish descent.

golda-meir.name: Golda Meir
golda-meir.bio: Israeli stateswoman (1898-1978). Born Golda Mabovitch in Kyiv, raised in Milwaukee. 4th Prime Minister of Israel (1969-1974). Called the "Iron Lady" before Thatcher. Led Israel during the 1973 Yom Kippur War. One of the founders of the State of Israel.

david-ben-gurion.name: David Ben-Gurion
david-ben-gurion.bio: Israeli statesman (1886-1973). Born David Grun in Plonsk, Poland. Primary national founder and first Prime Minister of Israel (1948-1954, 1955-1963). Proclaimed Israeli independence on May 14, 1948. Built the IDF, Histadrut, and foundation of the state.

menachem-begin.name: Menachem Begin
menachem-begin.bio: Israeli politician and Nobel Peace Prize laureate (1913-1992). Born in Brest-Litovsk, Russia (now Belarus), to a Zionist family. 6th Prime Minister of Israel (1977-1983). Led the Irgun (paramilitary). Signed the Camp David Accords with Sadat (1978).

yitzhak-rabin.name: Yitzhak Rabin
yitzhak-rabin.bio: Israeli politician and general (1922-1995). 5th Prime Minister (1974-1977, 1992-1995). Won Nobel Peace Prize for Oslo Accords with PLO. Assassinated by Jewish extremist Yigal Amir on November 4, 1995, at a peace rally in Tel Aviv.

shimon-peres.name: Shimon Peres
shimon-peres.bio: Israeli statesman (1923-2016). Born Szymon Perski in Wiszniew, Poland. 9th President and twice Prime Minister of Israel. Won Nobel Peace Prize in 1994 for Oslo Accords. Father of Israel's nuclear program. Longest-serving Israeli parliamentarian. Founded Peres Center for Peace.

ruth-bader-ginsburg.name: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
ruth-bader-ginsburg.bio: American jurist (1933-2020). Born Joan Ruth Bader in Brooklyn to a Jewish family. Associate Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court (1993-2020). Second woman to serve on the Court. Known as the "Notorious RBG." Pioneer of gender equality jurisprudence. Cultural icon.

sandy-koufax.name: Sandy Koufax
sandy-koufax.bio: American baseball pitcher (1935-). Hall of Famer. One of the greatest pitchers in history. Famous for refusing to pitch Game 1 of the 1965 World Series on Yom Kippur.

bob-dylan.name: Bob Dylan
bob-dylan.bio: American singer-songwriter (1941-). Born Robert Allen Zimmerman. Nobel Prize in Literature 2016. One of the most influential musicians of the 20th century.

leonard-cohen.name: Leonard Cohen
leonard-cohen.bio: Canadian singer-songwriter, poet, and novelist (1934-2016). Born into an influential Montreal Jewish family. Known for 'Hallelujah' and deeply spiritual works.

barbra-streisand.name: Barbra Streisand
barbra-streisand.bio: American singer, actress, and filmmaker (1942-). One of the best-selling recording artists of all time with over 150 million records sold. EGOT winner.

itzhak-perlman.name: Itzhak Perlman
itzhak-perlman.bio: Israeli-American violinist. One of the greatest living classical musicians. Named in Epstein's black book. Epstein cultivated relationships with prominent cultural figures as part of his social strategy.

daniel-barenboim.name: Daniel Barenboim
daniel-barenboim.bio: Argentine-Israeli pianist and conductor (1942-). Founded the West-Eastern Divan Orchestra with Edward Said to promote Israeli-Palestinian dialogue.

saul-bellow.name: Saul Bellow
saul-bellow.bio: Canadian-American writer (1915-2005). Nobel Prize in Literature 1976. Known for 'The Adventures of Augie March,' 'Herzog,' and 'Humboldt's Gift.'

philip-roth.name: Philip Roth
philip-roth.bio: American novelist (1933-2018). Author of 'Portnoy's Complaint,' 'American Survey,' and many others. Won the Pulitzer Prize and nearly every major literary award.

mel-brooks.name: Mel Brooks
mel-brooks.bio: American filmmaker, comedian, and songwriter (1926-). EGOT winner. Known for 'The Producers,' 'Blazing Saddles,' 'Young Frankenstein.' Served in WWII.

irving-berlin.name: Irving Berlin
irving-berlin.bio: Belarusian-born American composer (1888-1989). Wrote 'God Bless America,' 'White Christmas,' and nearly 1,500 songs. Born Israel Isidore Baline to a Jewish family.

george-gershwin.name: George Gershwin
george-gershwin.bio: American composer and pianist (1898-1937). Composed 'Rhapsody in Blue,' 'An American in Paris,' and 'Porgy and Bess.' Born to a Russian Jewish immigrant family in Brooklyn.

leonard-bernstein.name: Leonard Bernstein
leonard-bernstein.bio: American conductor, composer, and pianist (1918-1990). Composed 'West Side Story.' First American conductor to lead a major symphony orchestra.

jonas-salk.name: Jonas Salk
jonas-salk.bio: American virologist (1914-1995). Developed the first successful polio vaccine. Born to Russian-Jewish immigrant parents. Refused to patent the vaccine.

hedy-lamarr.name: Hedy Lamarr
hedy-lamarr.bio: Austrian-American actress and inventor (1914-2000). Born Hedwig Eva Maria Kiesler to a Jewish family in Vienna. Co-invented frequency-hopping technology used in WiFi and Bluetooth.

marc-chagall.name: Marc Chagall
marc-chagall.bio: Russian-French artist (1887-1985). Born Moishe Shagal to a Hasidic Jewish family in Vitebsk. One of the most successful artists of the 20th century.

amedeo-modigliani.name: Amedeo Modigliani
amedeo-modigliani.bio: Italian painter and sculptor (1884-1920). Born to a Sephardic Jewish family in Livorno. Known for portraiture and nudes with elongated forms.

primo-levi.name: Primo Levi
primo-levi.bio: Italian Jewish chemist, partisan, and author (1919-1987). Holocaust survivor whose memoir 'If This Is a Man' is considered one of the most important works of the 20th century.

dario-amodei.name: Dario Amodei
dario-amodei.bio: American AI researcher and CEO of Anthropic, the AI safety company behind Claude. Previously served as VP of Research at OpenAI. A leading voice in responsible AI development and existential risk from artificial intelligence.

brian-armstrong.name: Brian Armstrong
brian-armstrong.bio: American billionaire entrepreneur and co-founder and CEO of Coinbase, the largest cryptocurrency exchange in the United States. Led Coinbase to a direct listing on NASDAQ in 2021. A major advocate for cryptocurrency regulation and mainstream adoption.

vlad-tenev.name: Vlad Tenev
vlad-tenev.bio: Bulgarian-American billionaire entrepreneur and co-founder and CEO of Robinhood Markets, the commission-free trading platform that democratized stock trading. Born to Jewish parents in Bulgaria. The app's role in the 2021 GameStop saga made him a controversial figure.

morris-chang.name: Morris Chang
morris-chang.bio: Chinese-American Taiwanese businessman who founded TSMC and is called the 'Father of semiconductor manufacturing.'

irina-nevzlin.name: Irina Nevzlin
irina-nevzlin.bio: Chairwoman of the Board of Directors of the Museum of the Jewish People. Russian-Israeli philanthropist.

affiliations.organization: Museum of the Jewish People at Beit Hatfutsot

dan-tadmor.name: Dan Tadmor
dan-tadmor.bio: Israeli media executive who has served in senior positions at Israeli media companies. Active in the Israeli technology and media ecosystem, helping shape the digital transformation of Israeli media and entertainment.

affiliations.organization: Museum of the Jewish People at Beit Hatfutsot

harvey-glasser.name: Harvey Glasser
harvey-glasser.bio: American sports executive. Longtime president of Maccabi USA, the organization that sends U.S. athletes to compete in the Maccabiah Games in Israel - the third-largest international sporting event in the world. Advocate for Jewish sports participation.

seth-pinsky.name: Seth Pinsky
seth-pinsky.bio: CEO of the 92nd Street Y/92NY since 2020, former NYC Economic Development Corporation president.

sol-adler.name: Sol Adler
sol-adler.bio: Founding member of the Young Men's Hebrew Association which became the 92nd Street Y.

hadar-susskind.name: Hadar Susskind
hadar-susskind.bio: American Jewish advocacy leader and president and CEO of Americans for Peace Now, a progressive pro-Israel organization. Advocates for a two-state solution and Israeli-Palestinian peace. Previously worked at the Jewish Federations of North America.

jeff-shell.name: Jeff Shell
jeff-shell.bio: American media executive. Born to a Jewish family. CEO of NBCUniversal (2020-2023). Resigned over inappropriate conduct. Previously chairman of NBCUniversal International and former president of Comcast Programming Group. Oversaw Peacock streaming launch.

mark-lazarus.name: Mark Lazarus
mark-lazarus.bio: American media executive and chairman of NBCUniversal Media Group, overseeing NBC, Bravo, USA Network, and other properties. Led the expansion of NBC Sports and Peacock streaming service. One of the most powerful Jewish executives in American media.

james-gorman.name: James Gorman
james-gorman.bio: Australian-American banker and former CEO and chairman of Morgan Stanley (2010-2024). Under his leadership, Morgan Stanley's market cap more than tripled. Previously served as president and COO. Named by Time as one of the 100 most influential people.

ted-pick.name: Ted Pick
ted-pick.bio: American banker and CEO of Morgan Stanley since January 2024, succeeding James Gorman. Previously led the firm's institutional securities business. Rose through Morgan Stanley's sales and trading ranks over a 30-year career at the firm.

jason-matheny.name: Jason Matheny
jason-matheny.bio: President and CEO of RAND Corporation since 2022. Former founding director of CSET at Georgetown.

michael-froman.name: Michael Froman
michael-froman.bio: President of the Council on Foreign Relations since 2023. Former US Trade Representative.

joseph-shenker.name: Joseph Shenker
joseph-shenker.bio: American attorney. Chairman of Sullivan & Cromwell LLP, one of America's oldest and most prestigious law firms (founded 1879). Jewish. Sullivan & Cromwell has been at the center of major M&A deals, SEC investigations, and corporate governance matters for over a century.

jon-ballis.name: Jon Ballis
jon-ballis.bio: American healthcare executive and community leader who has been involved in Jewish organizational life and charitable giving. Active in supporting Jewish communal institutions and healthcare initiatives.

miguel-patricio.name: Miguel Patricio
miguel-patricio.bio: Brazilian-Portuguese business executive. CEO of Kraft Heinz Company (2019-2024). Oversaw one of America's largest food companies. Previously spent 20+ years at Anheuser-Busch InBev. Kraft Heinz was formed from a merger orchestrated by 3G Capital and Berkshire Hathaway.

alexandre-behring.name: Alexandre Behring
alexandre-behring.bio: Brazilian billionaire businessman and co-founder and managing partner of 3G Capital, known for the acquisitions of Burger King, Tim Hortons, and Heinz. His cost-cutting "zero-based budgeting" approach has transformed the food and beverage industry.

ali-ghodsi.name: Ali Ghodsi
ali-ghodsi.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Databricks, the data and AI company valued at over $40 billion.

deborah-lipstadt.name: Deborah Lipstadt
deborah-lipstadt.bio: American historian. Born 1947 in New York City to a Jewish family. U.S. Special Envoy to Monitor and Combat Antisemitism (2022-2025). Professor at Emory University. Defeated Holocaust denier David Irving in landmark legal case. Author of "Denying the Holocaust."

affiliations.organization: US Special Envoy to Monitor and Combat Antisemitism

elan-carr.name: Elan Carr
elan-carr.bio: Former Special Envoy to Monitor and Combat Antisemitism under the Trump administration.

affiliations.organization: US Special Envoy to Monitor and Combat Antisemitism

sara-bloomfield.name: Sara Bloomfield
sara-bloomfield.bio: American museum executive and director of the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum (USHMM) since 1999. Under her leadership, the museum has become the leading Holocaust research and education institution, welcoming over 45 million visitors.

andrew-silow-carroll.name: Andrew Silow-Carroll
andrew-silow-carroll.bio: American journalist and former editor-in-chief of the Jewish Telegraphic Agency (JTA). A prominent voice in Jewish media who has shaped coverage of American Jewish life, identity, and politics. Previously edited the New Jersey Jewish News.

suzanne-maloney.name: Suzanne Maloney
suzanne-maloney.bio: American foreign policy scholar and vice president of the Brookings Institution's Foreign Policy program. A leading expert on Iran and Middle East policy. Previously served in the State Department's Office of Policy Planning.

natan-sachs.name: Natan Sachs
natan-sachs.bio: Director of the Center for Middle East Policy at Brookings, specializing in Israeli politics.

mariano-florentino-cuellar.name: Mariano-Florentino Cuellar
mariano-florentino-cuellar.bio: President of the Carnegie Endowment since 2021. Former California Supreme Court Justice.

aaron-david-miller.name: Aaron David Miller
aaron-david-miller.bio: American author, analyst, and diplomat. Senior fellow at Carnegie Endowment. Former U.S. State Department advisor on Arab-Israeli negotiations for 25 years across Democratic and Republican administrations. Author of "The Much Too Promised Land."

dennis-ross.name: Dennis Ross
dennis-ross.bio: American diplomat and author. Born 1948 in San Francisco. Former special envoy for Middle East peace under Bush and Clinton. Director of policy planning at the State Department. Senior fellow at the Washington Institute for Near East Policy.

affiliations.organization: Washington Institute for Near East Policy (WINEP)

nahum-goldmann.name: Nahum Goldmann
nahum-goldmann.bio: Lithuanian-born Jewish leader who co-founded the World Jewish Congress and led initial reparations negotiations with Germany.

affiliations.organization: Conference on Jewish Material Claims Against Germany (Claims Conference)

ruth-porat.name: Ruth Porat
ruth-porat.bio: American financial executive. Born 1957 in Manchester, England, to a Jewish family. President and Chief Investment Officer of Alphabet/Google. Previously CFO of Morgan Stanley. Named repeatedly among the most powerful women in finance.

safra-catz.name: Safra Catz
safra-catz.bio: CEO of Oracle since 2014. Born in Holon, Israel. One of the highest-paid female executives in the world.

george-roberts.name: George Roberts
george-roberts.bio: American Jewish billionaire businessman and co-founder of KKR (Kohlberg Kravis Roberts), one of the world's largest private equity firms. Pioneer of the leveraged buyout industry alongside cousin Henry Kravis. KKR manages over $500 billion in assets.

scott-nuttall.name: Scott Nuttall
scott-nuttall.bio: American businessman and co-CEO of KKR (Kohlberg Kravis Roberts). Has led KKR's expansion into credit, infrastructure, and technology investments. One of the most influential figures in private equity, overseeing billions in global investments.

jim-simons.name: Jim Simons
jim-simons.bio: Mathematician and founder of Renaissance Technologies. His Medallion Fund generated the best track record in investing history. Major philanthropist supporting math and science education. Passed away in May 2024.

peter-brown.name: Peter Brown
peter-brown.bio: American mathematician and co-CEO of Renaissance Technologies, the most profitable hedge fund in history. Succeeded Jim Simons in leading the firm. Renaissance's Medallion Fund has generated average annual returns exceeding 60% before fees since 1988.

yossi-sariel.name: Yossi Sariel
yossi-sariel.bio: Former commander of Unit 8200 who has spoken publicly about the unit's role in Israel's tech ecosystem.

omri-lavie.name: Omri Lavie
omri-lavie.bio: Israeli entrepreneur and co-founder of NSO Group alongside Shalev Hulio. NSO Group developed the controversial Pegasus spyware used by governments worldwide. The company has faced lawsuits from Apple and Meta over surveillance of journalists and activists.

gaby-portnoy.name: Gaby Portnoy
gaby-portnoy.bio: Israeli cybersecurity official and former director general of the Israel National Cyber Directorate. Led Israel's national cybersecurity strategy, positioning Israel as a global leader in cyber defense and protection of critical infrastructure.

stanley-fischer.name: Stanley Fischer
stanley-fischer.bio: Israeli-American economist. Born 1943 in Mazabuka, Northern Rhodesia (now Zambia), to a Jewish family. Governor of the Bank of Israel (2005-2013). Vice Chair of the Federal Reserve (2014-2017). Former first deputy managing director of the IMF.

phil-rosenberg.name: Phil Rosenberg
phil-rosenberg.bio: British Jewish communal leader and president of the Board of Deputies of British Jews, the main representative body for the UK Jewish community. Advocates for Jewish community interests and combating antisemitism in British public life.

michael-wegier.name: Michael Wegier
michael-wegier.bio: British Jewish community executive and former CEO of the United Jewish Israel Appeal (UJIA), one of the UK's largest Jewish charities. Has led fundraising and educational programs connecting British Jewry with Israel.

mark-gardner.name: Mark Gardner
mark-gardner.bio: CEO of the Community Security Trust, leading Jewish community security in the UK.

jillian-segal.name: Jillian Segal
jillian-segal.bio: Australian Jewish communal leader and former president of the Executive Council of Australian Jewry (ECAJ). A corporate lawyer and company director who has served on multiple boards and advocated for Jewish community interests.

priscilla-chan.name: Priscilla Chan
priscilla-chan.bio: American pediatrician and philanthropist, co-founder of the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (CZI) with husband Mark Zuckerberg. Born to Chinese-Vietnamese refugee parents. CZI has committed over $3 billion to education, science, and criminal justice reform.

norm-coleman.name: Norm Coleman
norm-coleman.bio: American Jewish politician and attorney, former US Senator from Minnesota (2003-2009) and chairman of the Republican Jewish Coalition. Previously mayor of Saint Paul, Minnesota. Lost his 2008 Senate race to Al Franken by 312 votes.

mark-mellman.name: Mark Mellman
mark-mellman.bio: Founder and CEO of Democratic Majority for Israel. Veteran Democratic pollster and political strategist.

meredith-kopit-levien.name: Meredith Kopit Levien
meredith-kopit-levien.bio: American businesswoman and CEO of The New York Times Company since 2020. Has led the Times' digital subscription and diversification strategy, growing digital subscribers past 10 million. Previously served as COO and head of advertising.

noam-bardin.name: Noam Bardin
noam-bardin.bio: Former CEO of Waze who led the company through its acquisition by Google and subsequent growth.

ziv-aviram.name: Ziv Aviram
ziv-aviram.bio: Israeli entrepreneur and co-founder of Mobileye alongside Amnon Shashua. Served as Mobileye's CEO until its acquisition by Intel for $15.3 billion in 2017. Also co-founded OrCam Technologies, developing AI-powered assistive devices for the visually impaired.

philip-rosenfeld.name: Philip Rosenfeld
philip-rosenfeld.bio: Australian Jewish community leader and executive who has served in leadership positions within Australian Jewish organizations. Active in promoting Jewish cultural life and communal development in Australia.

mark-wilf.name: Mark Wilf
mark-wilf.bio: American Jewish businessman and co-owner of the Minnesota Vikings NFL team. The Wilf family, of Holocaust survivor background, purchased the Vikings in 2005. Also a major real estate developer through Garden Homes, their family business.

bernard-lander.name: Bernard Lander
bernard-lander.bio: Rabbi and educator who founded Touro College in 1970 to serve underserved communities.

alan-kadish.name: Alan Kadish
alan-kadish.bio: American physician and president of Touro University, one of the largest Jewish-sponsored educational systems in the US. An accomplished cardiologist, he has expanded Touro's medical and professional programs across multiple states and countries.

cindy-greenberg.name: Cindy Greenberg
cindy-greenberg.bio: American Jewish community leader and philanthropist active in supporting Jewish education and social services. Involved in major American Jewish organizations promoting Jewish continuity and community development.

julie-platt.name: Julie Platt
julie-platt.bio: Chair of the Board of Trustees of JFNA. Prominent communal leader and philanthropist.

affiliations.organization: The Jewish Federations of North America

mark-charendoff.name: Mark Charendoff
mark-charendoff.bio: President of the Maimonides Fund and former president of the Jewish Funders Network.

winnie-sandler-grinspoon.name: Winnie Sandler Grinspoon
winnie-sandler-grinspoon.bio: American Jewish philanthropist and president of the Harold Grinspoon Foundation, continuing the family's legacy of supporting Jewish life through the PJ Library children's book program and JCamp 180 summer camp initiative.

michael-masters.name: Michael Masters
michael-masters.bio: American Jewish communal leader and former CEO of the Secure Community Network (SCN), the security arm of the Jewish community in North America. Led efforts to protect Jewish institutions against threats and enhance communal security.

yehuda-kurtzer.name: Yehuda Kurtzer
yehuda-kurtzer.bio: President of the Shalom Hartman Institute of North America. Scholar of American Jewish life.

jeremy-fingerman.name: Jeremy Fingerman
jeremy-fingerman.bio: CEO of the Foundation for Jewish Camp. Former executive at major consumer brands.

idit-klein.name: Idit Klein
idit-klein.bio: Co-founder, president and CEO of Keshet. Leading voice for LGBTQ+ inclusion in Jewish life.

gilles-darmon.name: Gilles Darmon
gilles-darmon.bio: French-born Israeli founder of Latet, Israel's largest humanitarian aid organization.

eran-weintrob.name: Eran Weintrob
eran-weintrob.bio: Israeli businessman and technology executive who has been involved in Israeli tech companies and venture capital. Part of Israel's dynamic technology ecosystem connecting entrepreneurs with global markets.

eli-bin.name: Eli Bin
eli-bin.bio: Director General of Magen David Adom, Israel's national emergency medical service.

michael-sfard.name: Michael Sfard
michael-sfard.bio: Leading Israeli human rights attorney and legal adviser to Yesh Din. Author and legal scholar.

ran-guron.name: Ran Guron
ran-guron.bio: Israeli businessman and Managing Director of Discount Investment Corporation, part of the IDB Group. Has played a significant role in Israeli corporate governance and investment management.

claudia-mendoza.name: Claudia Mendoza
claudia-mendoza.bio: British Jewish communal leader. CEO of the Jewish Leadership Council (JLC), the representative body bringing together leaders of major British Jewish organizations. Previously held senior roles in Jewish communal organizations and advocacy.

jonathan-goldstein.name: Jonathan Goldstein
jonathan-goldstein.bio: British Jewish community leader and chairman of the Jewish Leadership Council, representing UK Jewish institutions. A financier by profession and influential advocate for Jewish community interests in British public policy.

michael-etherton.name: Michael Etherton
michael-etherton.bio: British Jewish filmmaker and director of the UK Jewish Film Festival (UKJFF), the largest Jewish film festival in Europe. Has championed Jewish cinema and storytelling, showcasing films from Israel and Jewish communities worldwide.

raymond-sherr.name: Raymond Sherr
raymond-sherr.bio: British Jewish community executive and CEO of JW3, London's Jewish community center in Hampstead. Has built JW3 into a vibrant cultural hub offering arts, education, and social programs for the North London Jewish community.

toby-simpson.name: Toby Simpson
toby-simpson.bio: Director of the Wiener Holocaust Library, managing one of the world's oldest Holocaust archives.

philippe-allouche.name: Philippe Allouche
philippe-allouche.bio: French Jewish educational leader and executive director of the Alliance Israélite Universelle education network. Oversees a global network of Jewish schools and educational programs spanning multiple continents.

affiliations.organization: Fondation pour la Memoire de la Shoah

patricia-sitruk.name: Patricia Sitruk
patricia-sitruk.bio: Director General of OSE-France, overseeing health and social service operations.

hetty-berg.name: Hetty Berg
hetty-berg.bio: Dutch museum director and general director of the Jewish Museum Berlin since 2020. Previously spent 30 years at the Jewish Historical Museum in Amsterdam. A leading voice in how Jewish museums present Jewish culture, history, and identity.

naomi-azrieli.name: Naomi Azrieli
naomi-azrieli.bio: Canadian-Israeli Jewish philanthropist and CEO of the Azrieli Foundation. Daughter of David Azrieli, she continues the family's legacy of supporting education, research, and architecture in Israel and Canada. Oversees the foundation's $2+ billion endowment.

kevin-sumption.name: Kevin Sumption
kevin-sumption.bio: Australian museum executive. CEO and Director of the Sydney Jewish Museum, which combines Holocaust education with documenting the history of the Australian Jewish community. Museum features survivor testimonies and interactive exhibitions.

rabbi-ruben-sternschein.name: Rabbi Ruben Sternschein
rabbi-ruben-sternschein.bio: Senior Rabbi of Congregacao Israelita Paulista, one of the leading liberal rabbis in Latin America.

robert-bank.name: Robert Bank
robert-bank.bio: President and CEO of American Jewish World Service, the premier Jewish global human rights organization.

jonathan-davis.name: Jonathan Davis
jonathan-davis.bio: Director General and CEO of World ORT, operating education programs in 35 countries.

moshe-kantor.name: Moshe Kantor
moshe-kantor.bio: Russian-Israeli industrialist and former president of the European Jewish Congress. Sanctioned by the EU in 2022.

peter-orszag.name: Peter Orszag
peter-orszag.bio: CEO of Lazard. Former Director of the Office of Management and Budget under President Obama.

mark-walter.name: Mark Walter
mark-walter.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Guggenheim Partners. Part-owner of the Los Angeles Dodgers.

rich-handler.name: Rich Handler
